review: Happy Hour all day Sundays... $10 pitchers of beer and 1/2 price appetizers.. that was the pros Cons: They ran out of potstickers, milk and the waitress was a little slow

GLASS in dessert.... We dined here on 1/28/12 and everything was going great. The wait was not bad (30mins) , the service was ok (usual busy Sat night), and the food came out quickly. No complaints about service prior to dessert.  My boyfriend and I ordered the the 3 course meal for $20, which included 1 starter, 2 entree's, and 1 dessert. The meal was completed and we chose the strawberry shortcake sundae. After about 3 bites, my boyfriend scooped some ice cream and felt something sharp in his mouth. Thinking that it was ice, he moved the object with his tongue and spit it out immediately. Between his fingers was a shard of glass. While examining the shard of glass he noticed that the roof of his mouth had been cut by the glass and was bleeding. He even used the napkin to blot the area to make sure he wasn't mistaking the blood taste in his mouth.  Our waitress was called over (Brittany) and she said, "Oh my gosh, are you ok?! Let me go get my manager!" She quickly went and got her manager. Mike, manager who came to our table, asked "What happened? May I see the glass? Was it found in the dessert?"  in that exact order. After answering all of the questions, he then asked, "Are you ok?" My boyfriend replied with, "Yes, but I was suprised to find the glass in the ice cream and the roof of my mouth is bleeding." The manager then proceeds with,"Well, I'm glad you are ok, that is my main concern." My boyfriends card had already been charged with the total of our meal and Mike asked for the bill so that he could make some adjustments to it. He came back and said that since we had so many promotions, he tried to reduce our bill without interupting the discounts we had already had. ( Our bill included 2 orders of the 3 course for $20 and a child dinner.)  Mike ended up taking $30 off of our bill and apologized for what happened.  We eat at TGI Friday's often and normally, we are satisfied with the service and quality of food. The problem I am having is that the situation was not handeled properly. Glass, especially in food is extremely dangerous. We, at the table (4 adults, 1 child) did not cause a scene. We did not announce to the whiole restaurant that something was wrong. That was not our intention to get a free meal nor did we expect our meal to be free.  I am disappointed that Mike brushed off the situation with taking $30 off of the bill. Shouldn't it be protocal for the manager to take down my boyfriend's information and make a formal report? None of this was done and we were left at the table with just the bill and no dessert.  I would think that such a big corporation would want to exceed in customer service and want for their customers to return. Maybe acknowledging that something did happen and offering just something for my boyfriend to return to the restaurant would have been nice. Mike did not even thank us for choosing to eat at Friday's and did not mention that he would like for us to return. A voucher for something for my boyfriend to return or his information so that someone could follow up on the situation would have made us feel that Friday's really does care about their customers. Unless this matter is taken seriously by Friday's management and corporation, my family and friends will not be dining at Fridays any time soon.

this review is for you Dearest M--t, I like to tip my servers VERY well, but you sir...wow, you just blew me away! That passive aggressive tone we SO enjoyed every time you came to the table. The sarcastic tone when you asked us follow-up questions. You did a good job... Brava!

This review is only for the happy hour at the bar area. This is my local Friday's, I could walk there if i wanted, and I enjoy their HH apps., and drink specials, their best bartenders are Melissa, Richard, and Christiline. The worst bartender in my opinion is a guy called Randy, he is slow, unfreindly, makes bad drinks, and is very sloppy. I once saw him eating behind the bar. when he is the only bartender behind the bar we will just leave.  I always like sitting at the bar, quick service from a freindly crew, except that joker i mentioned earlier who is not qualified to even bartend at a dive bar.

The 2 person, 3 course, $20 isn't bad. Sometimes we go on the weekends after 10pm just for happy hour and to get dessert. Brownie obsession is awesome. Ice cream, warm brownie, hot fudge, caramel, and nuts. It gets very crowded and loud in here.
Updating my review.... I was at Fridays today ...awesome service compared to other times......  the wait was like 15min. And the place was packed :) manager Was sooooooo nice :)

I thought that the service improved since coming here months ago, but it still needs improvement. The food was good - I ordered the Crab Mac N Cheese, and it was delicious. Haven't tried the desert yet over here. Came on a Sunday afternoon and the bar area was packed with people watching football - it was loud (to be expected).

Since it's just down the hill, I grabbed the "Buy One Get One Free" coupon in my mail and tried T.G.I Friday, for the first time. The lunch hour was not too busy when I arrived. The hostess was friendly and seated me by the window. When I mentioned the coupon, the waitress was very friendly and said "Anything you like!" So I ordered baby back ribs and fried shrimp, along a baked potato skin.  The ribs were actually very tender and flavorful. Fried shrimp were crunchy and not bready at all. There could be more toppings on the potato skin but I could not complain much because I was stuffed. I'd say my first time at TGIF was pleasant, nothing too special, yet no disappointment, either. Isn't it how franchised restaurant should offer?
Alright fridays... i couldn't get over a whiff of urine that passed as we were eating our meal... *smh* no bueno.

Crap crap crappy!  I'm not sure what made us come here, but we're sure the heck NEVER coming back. Food:  sub-par.  I'm preggos so i ordered my steak medium-well, which came out bloody pink in the middle.  How come i can't get it that pink when i order medium-rare, i'll never figure it out.  Maybe its because in places like this the cooks arent trained properly because they're disposable.  Same goes for the wait staff, lazy and mediocre.  The waiter actually passed our entrees through the railing from the bar area instead of walking up two steps to place it properly in front of us. Aaand, coleslaw was warm.  Not room temp, WARM like it had been sitting at the pass waiting for the rest of the food to be made. Lastly, the busboy hovered waiting for us to leave.  I boxed up my steak, planning on cooking it a little longer at home and DUH, i walked away from the table without grabbing the box.  Again, i'm preggos and forgetful.  When i went back 30 seconds later, the busboy who WATCHED US walk away from the table, had tossed my box in his dishbin instead of walking 10 feet after us....i said, "aww, you tossed my steak." The stupid kid said, "it's right there if you want it." It was sitting in about an inch of water and soda in a nasty bucket.  I replied, "um, do i want that now?" The kid said, "i dont know, do you?" I wanted to slap him.  Instead i recounted this to the manager, who NEVER apologized, never asked WHO was rude, and looked a bit amused.  He DID offer another steak, which is how you solve problems there, by throwing meat at it.  I just looked at the guy like, wtf?  He just wanted to go back to flirting with the hostess.  Horrible food, horrible service, clueless management.  They should close the kitchen and focus on serving giant Adios Motherf*ckers and bland beer.

We usually go to Outback after the Tuesday golf class, but this time my boyfriend said why don't we try something new. Let's go to TGI friday's!! It turns out a very very back decision!!!!! The food taste like sh*t! And it is over priced, why should I that much money to something taste so terrible! The dinning environment is not good, the table is sticky, so is the floor. And the waitress just doing nothing but standing together at the front desk laughing and gossiping. I wonder how the manager trained and manages his staff, if I was the owner I would serious consider fire them all and sell this place, it is a better way to use money. In one word I would never never go this place again!!

This is the worst chain of TGI Fridays I have ever been to and the sad part is, I've been here before!! And had good food! I don't know what happened to this place, but the quality has gone waaay down at this branch. TGI Fridays is supposed to be known for their steaks. I've had my own family members order the Jack Daniel's Flat Iron Steak and say it was good. So, in celebration of my brother's birthday, I don't if it was because they were understaffed tonight or what, but the waiter got my brother's beer order wrong twice. When we ordered our food, it took over 1/2 hour to finally get our food!!  I ordered a steak for myself. WORST DECISION I EVER MADE. I ordered the Jack Daniels Flat Iron Steak rare. What did I get?? I got a RAW steak.I sent it back and when it came back 10 minutes later, I discovered it had been placed in the oven and the inside was barely discernably better than raw. My brother ordered the Tuscan Pasta shrimp. The shrimp on skewers looked like they had been sitting on the plate long enough to give the appearance of dryness. Another family member had pork chops with some fried onion rings sitting on top of the pork chops and by the time the plate got to our table, the onion rings had gone somewhat limp and soggy looking from sitting on top of the pork chop for so long. NOT GOOD. This place does not deserve another trip here from me again. I have to say they were busy tonight, but that does not excuse the poor shape of the food we ate today. Whoever the chef is back there does not know what they're doing. If you have a neighborhood TGI Fridays in your area and is decent, than stay at that one This one is not worth it. You're better off cooking your own at home compared to this place

Went there for good ol' times sake... A friend from Europe came to visit and we used to go there all the time (20 years ago ;-))when we were both living here... Saw the reviews and ALMOST suggested we go to another place... but hey... my friend wanted her chicken fingers and garlic sticks, so we went...  As many reviews mentioned.. the service lacks.... We ordered three diet cokes... we got TWO diet cokes and a Lemonade... (WTF?!)... My friends are just too polite to even say anything.. they just went like.. oh well.. I like Lemonade too... food was okay, but not as good as it was back then and no cute (male) waiters anymore..

I went here for my birthday and had the worst restaurant experience of my life. At the risk of being laughed at, here is the funny short story for your entertainment, and as a warning to stay away from this terrible place. My friends and I were all having some drinks and waiting for dinner.  The girls were having their over-priced, over-sized, over-sugared cups and me a beer, which I finished. The waiter came over and said since it's my birthday I should have a "waterfall."  I said okay.  A few minutes later he came back and stood next to me at the head of the table and said that my drink was on its way.  But before I got it, I had to say, "waterfall, waterfall, waterfall."  So I did. Waterfall, waterfall, waterfall! Then the waiter dumped a pitcher of ice water over my head, soaking me and my shirt. As a former Kenpo tournament fighter, I jumped out of my chair and considered a waterfall of fists to the waiter's face.  Instead my good senses of not wanting to be arrested kicked in.  I took off my shirt and threw it on the floor. The waiter then told me to lighten up, that it was just a joke.  I told him to get me a f*cking towel and a very nervous girl brought me one.  I wiped off as the waiter laughed.  I decided to take the high road here, and simply picked up my shirt and walked out. TGI Fridays, I will never go back to any of your restaurants.  I will continue to tell this story.  I will watch as your business, which does not respect customers fails.   Cheers.

I had low expectations since I forgot about this place for so long but my wife and I had the best experience on Monday, 7/9 about 2pm. First off we were warmly greeted at the door.  (Something lacking in too many places) Claudia our waitress was very attentive and prompt (once we decided what to get from their huge menu).  I highly recommend the pulled pork sandwich.  Here's what pushed this experience into 5 star category for me.  When my wife asked for a soda refill at the end of our meal Claudia (on her own) brought it in a to-go cup.  She also brought me an iced tea to go as well. Very nice touch. Like I said before an excellent dining experience.

Horrible service Our server never bothered to bring out our appetizers before our entrees but even when we asked it took him another 5 minutes to bring them out. The waiter tried to bring us Strawberry Lemonades we never ordered twice. He had forgotten to bring my sister's tacos and said he would do so right away. Then our table was forgotten. Our drinks were never refilled and he didn't come back until maybe another 15 minutes later empty handed. We asked about the tacos again but he blamed the kitchen claiming he had no idea why they were taking so long. He disappears for another 5 minutes and when we look down the hall he was chatting with some other female waiters. He finally noticed us and brought out my sisters tacos in a minute (I guess it was the kitchen's fault, according to our waiter.....) While he was taking out plates away he told us he had the bill in his hand (we were expecting the bill) and said he'd give it to us. But he just took our plates away and didn't give us the bill. When he finally came back with it again we found that we were charged for the Strawberry Lemonades we never ordered instead of our regular Lemonades. We pointed it out and he told us it wasn't a big deal since it was just an extra 60¢... The nerve of this guy. My dad looked like he was about to explode in rage so I guess he got scared and ran off to make the changes. In the end my dad gave him a 12% tip but the rest of us agreed that he didn't deserve a tip at all. The food was alright though, I guess.

Let's start with the good Great Happy Hour prices, and great great selection of appetizers! Lot's of seating, and they're open super late (till 2am?) That's about it. Service is SO SLOW. Seriously the SLOWEST service I've ever received. Once our server came over, she was very pleasant, but my god we had to wait so long for EVERYTHING. We were in there for over an hour, and we were only there for a drink and a small bite! Food is meh....nothing to rave about.  I used to like this place, but it's pretty terrible now. Please get your sh*t together, Fridays! I want to enjoy your happy hour more often!

Good food, good prices and the atmosphere was just what was needed on a Friday Night after a long week. Oh and did I mention they support the local schools all the time, I give them two thumbs up for doing it right.

Who's down for HAPPY HOURS!!!.. I'm talking about half off all appetizers, beers, drinks, etc. As long as your standing, sitting, hopefully not laying down, in the bar section, your good. The bar section doesn't seem too pack on friday nights.  The only down side is happy hour doesn't start until 10pm. So if you get there around 8pm, you my have to kill time with water!
Service is terribly slow, the drinks are pretty watered down, and they are frequently out of common beers.

Ok so I've been here the last couple of times during happy hour and we were seated in the same section as before. The waiters here get 5*s because they were attentive, gave great suggestions and had the absolute best attitude I seen in a while! Ill keep coming back for that. On the food side of things I haven't had anything bad yet and everything has been above exceptional!!

Two words. "STAY AWAY"........ unless you want to get sick. We had eaten here in the past like two times, but last week. Both my wife and I got sick to their food. We noticed it tasted different from previous visit. We order the exact same thing from last time we were there. She had the jack Daniels chicken breast and I had the ribs with shrimp. I didn't taste my food because our baby was crying and we had to go but my wife did eat hers. Day after my wife wakes up with a fever and calls me at work. But within an hour its was gone. Me I had my food for lunch the same day my wife got sick. My long story short I actually ended up being hospitalized because of food poisoning.

Their happy hours aren't so bad. $5 margaritas..that come in a decent size amount. Not strong, of course.  Food is so so.  Ambiance is okay. Went there once during a Laker game..it was pretty intense in there.  When it was free throw time..EVVVVERYONE got insanely quiet..and when they made it..screams.

I created an account because of my experience here. Horrible service! It seemed like each server was under the impression someone else had our section. The food was very sub par. I got these new Korean BBQ tacos. The meat had soaked through the soft tacos and when I tried to pick it up a giant "O" fell out of the tortilla. This happened to all three tacos :/ The manager eventually dealt with our table and the table next to us, but the damage was done.  This place used to be a hotspot, what happened?!?

I'm not a fan of these chain restaurants to begin with. The only reason I went here is because I received a gift card from a friend for my recent birthday. It took them a while to seat us, the place was dirty, some of the clientele were undesirable, loud and uneducated frankly.  The food took a while to get out and its not as if we ordered anything complicated, a chicken salad and some tacos. The waitress was nice, she did the best she could for a young girl bless her heart but again I don't eat in these types of places normally and after this experience I am not inclined to do so again. One of the more unsatisfying experiences I have had in these places, second only to the one in times square in NYC, the worst ever!!! The epitome of LCD and horrible service and completely overpriced patheticness!!!

Barely a two-star. The only redeeming quality was the ribs, which were delicious and a waitress who wasn't ours checked up on us consistently and always with a smile. However, service was terrible, appetizer tasted stale, and I will not return to this location.

Well the kids seem to like it but let me say this food is NOT good, taste like microwave gourmet frozen meals. Poo wee, yucko however my server was the best!! She kept very professional and pleasant with the kids while serving us this crap!!!!

Bad Service, horrible food. Had to send the clam chowder back, it was brown! the server thought that was OK!?! WTF? Korean Tacos = BAD!  It's salad in corn tortilla.... if your lucky, you might get a few thin bits of meat.  Skillet Fries  + Soggy.... Too much sauce. Service. Wow that was the worst. TGIF only stay in business because it get the overflow for Olive Garden.

first of all, i must say i love eating at fridays in general... i went to this location for a late dinner. i arrived around 8:20 pm, and put my name on the "waiting" list. the host told me there would be a 20 minute wait... i waited 40 minutes to be seated, we had a party of 3. its now around 9:05 pm, the waiter came over and asked us what we would have to drink, we ordered 3 waters with lemon and 1 lemonade and vodka , he brought the waters out without lemon about 5 minutes later.. 15 minutes later, still no lemons and still no lemonade and vodka, i noticed the waiter was back and forth, tending to a table of six, i asked the waiter if he had put in an order for the vodka drink and he said yes, i asked if we could also have some lemons for the water.. 5 minutes later, he brought out the lemons, but still no drink, instead he asked for our order. we gave him our order and again asked about the lemonade and vodka, he said i will go get it now...5 minutes later, im starting to become irritated with the lack of service and asked my group if they preffered to go somewhere else because the lack of service... they said no, another 10 minutes goes by and what do you know, here come the drink without even a "sorry about the wait" or anything, by then im just done with the lack of service...i informed the waiter i was "over it" and was going somewhere else....i asked to speak waiting to speak to the manager, i also asked who the manager in charge was and she said Melissa, the hostess then paged the manager to the front...about 5 minutes later she said let me go get her.....out came a gentleman ( i think his name was Brian) and asked what was the problem, i informed him of the lack of service, and expressed myself in a very professional manner, as i was talking to him, he said well your food is now ready why dont you just stay and eat and he would comp our drink...i said i wasnt looking for a handout or anything i just wanted him to know what i had experienced.... he apologized and handed me his card which was titled "bar manager" and said next time i hope the service is better (the manager "Melissa" never came out at all!)... its now after 10:00 pm, and im just angry with the lack of service....        needless to say i wil NEVER go back to fridays in torrance!!!!!!!!        p.s. the hostess, seemed very caring and sincere      .i drove down the street to chili's and ordered my food, recieved great service, and was treated with appreciation as a customer!!!

We had a large party here celebrating a birthday the other night. We had reservations at 8 p.m. and we all got there and our table was ready right away. We had 2 hosts serving us throughout the evening. They were on top of it with food orders and keeping the drinks coming. I had the parmigiana crusted chicken which was o-kay. I've had better, but i liked that it came with a tomato and mozzarella salad on the side. Beef had the rib eye and chicken with the Jack Daniel's dipping sauce (soooo good!) We shared the vanilla cheesecake drizzled with chocolate syrup, also yummy. I had 2 drinks- one was the Ultimate 77 Sunset strip which was good but a little too sweet. The second was the Georgia Peach Tea. I love me some schnapps and this drink was perfect for me. I even got a little buzz going. Beef got some snobby sipping whiskey and the name escapes me at the moment. The service was great, but we were shocked when we received our portion of the bill. To help us out, they split the bill by seats and partners and our bill came out much higher than we thought it would be! They added gratuity to the bill which came out to be an extra $10 per couple. We did not tip because of this being included in our bill. TGIF is a good social bar/grill restaurant for friends. Not somewhere we would go and eat if it was just the two of us. It was nice to get out for a fun little evening.

Go to a Friday's maybe once a year, usually for lunch, because someone else wants to go. Every time I do, it confirms my feelings about eating there. The food is mediocre at best, over priced and service is worse than the food. Really don't understand how this place stays in business. How many first timers can they attract?

The boyfriend and I decided to come in and try this place, well after hearing hype from the T.V commercials. I have tried other places on commercial impresions alone, but I was very disappointed with this one.  When we got there, the hostess was having a conversation with another waitress. We stood there for a while, before I started to walk away, when the hostess finally decided that she was ready to stop talking and seat us. When we got to our table, we did not have a waitress/waitor greet us...AT ALL! Because of this, we had plenty of time to look at the menu, which is very unusual. Unusual to me because some of the foods did not go well together.  After not being asked about drinks or getting any help from anyone, we decided to leave and to go Chilis instead, which is down the street some ways. Better choice in the end.

Worst TGI EVER!!!! I wrote a review on 6/10/12 and b*tched abt their sh*tty service. Here I am.... 4/2/13 having to write yet another bad review. Yesterday was my birthday, and because I love TGI so much and we were staying in the area.... i figured I'd give this location another chance. BAD CHOICE! We sat at the bar, only a few people were there. The bartender acknowledged us but after 10 minutes of us sitting there and him not coming back we got up and left. We drove 2 minutes up the street to Chili's, where we were welcomed and served right away.  I don't know what it is about this location, it seems like everyone is having the same bad experience as we have had and regardless of the complaints it doesn't seem to change. I'll never be back to this location again.

What happened? Some friends and I visited Fridays last night. It's crazy how amazing and fun it looks on television. I was wrong- very wrong.  Usually, I would provide a detailed narrative in chronological order. This time, I'm gonna jump right into the meat and potatoes; DINNER!  I ordered the Sizzling Chicken with Shrimp. The picture on the menu portrayed two large cuts of chicken with exquisite color and character. Accompanied by a heap of mashed potatoes and several large succulent shrimp. Ding!!! Wrong again! What I was served compared to my meals aboard the USS ESSEX in 99'. My "mashed potatoes" tasted like powdered box potatoes, served with an ice cream scooper. The two pieces of chicken were the size of baby's fist and had the texture of a microwaveable TV Dinner.  Lastly, the 5 itty bitty pieces of shrimp I had were the size of a U.S quarter. Absolutely pathetic.  The service as okay but forget this joint. What a nightmare.
I like the atmosphere here and the food is good. a little pricey for me which is why it gets 4 stars instead of 5. If they'd offer coupons i'd come more often. Still a good spot to hit once a month.

Bad food, bad service, bad night of dinner. Yes, my wife and I were coming to visit a friend who was in a hospital in Torrance. As we headed back to Long Beach, my wife suggested that we go to stop at his Friday's on Hawthorne Blvd. I obliged her so we pulled in to the lot. First of all, it took the waitress 20 minutes before she even came to take our order. It wasn't that busy either. Then she finally brought our food out and it looked inedible. My Jack Daniel's ribs were dried out and appeared to be burnt. They were too tough to eat so I had the waitress take it back. I switched to the Salmon. My wife order the Friday's shrimp and oh what a sight! They were small and drenched in oil. She couldn't eat anymore because she said biting into the grease was making her nauseous,  Once they brought my salmon, I ate half and have the other half to my wife. It was okay but nothing to brag about. The waitress  didn't even discount our bill after we complained. This Friday's is the worst in our opinion. We'll never go there again, that's for sure.

A coworker and I chose Friday's for lunch on a weekday. Seated by an indifferent hostess. Server was very friendly and attentive and took our order. waiting for the food found the knife had a thick disgusting layer of dried food attached to it, have a picture but dont know how to upload it. Manager comes out with our food, I point out the knife and asked how this could've happened. Manager literally shrugs his shoulder, no eye contact the entire time, grabs the knife and brings a new one and leaves without a care. What a shame. Not coming back at least to this particular location. The two star Yelp rating is very accurate. Friday's has been the go to restaurants for special family occasions growing up and will always have fond affections for it. This Friday's is a disgrace.

Here we go ya'll!  Went here 6/5/13. Me and my BF always come here at least once a week. Is it me or has the service and food gone down the drain over the last 3 months? It's not me reading all the reviews below me. Mmmhmmm. I ain't crazy! So Sara, our waitress, was not good. She was very inattentive and uncaring. She forgot things about our order and after our food came out the 1st time, she never came to our table for the rest of the night. No where to be found! :( We placed our 2nd order with a waiter who passed by us. Duuude?!!! Really? Then when we asked the GM for a check, he gave it to us so speedily and then ran off too quick for me to dispute the margarita I got charged for and took 1 sip of. You wouldn't believe how nasty it was. It's a MARGARITA!??? How can u mess that up mister Bartender? Pppfffttt.  1. The need a new bartender. I mean, I'm all for the brothas' but that one HAS TO GO. You suck. 2. Better training of interpersonal skills for all wait staff, (except for the runners...they are all awesome!). Seriously, take some tips from the Bubba Gump waitstaff, (they're so awesome and funny! Mmm...now I'm kinda hungry for some shrimp....dang...) 3. The GM needs to relax. He runs around frantically like he's on 5 red bulls, (or some illegal substance named CRACK) and doesn't take the sweet, patient time to ask tables HOW THE HELL the food and service was.  *I'm getting really angry remembering this night...* F u Friday's! F ur Torrance waitstaff (except for the runners) oh yeah, and the hostesses suck too! :p Don't go here. Drinks suck. Food is ok at best. Service sucks.  Other awesome places: The Counter Torrance. Bubba Gumps....in Long Beach or Santa Monica. Hudson House in Redondo (kinda pricey but GREAT quality food and drinks!). Mediterraneo in Hermosa Beach. Hey! I should start a food blog! Who's with me?!!!!

I was craving a shrimp cocktail and thought this might be the place to get a good one. .......Not so fast.....    The staff was very friendly and efficient, the drink (Cosmopolitan) was good, but the shrimps were like pink erasers.  Maybe pink erasers would have had more taste.  A disappointment.
Was a nice place to go , now more of a noisy DIVE FOR YUPPIES !!!!!

No matter what Friday's you go to you will have quite a wait. As usual I was placed on the guest list. We waited the time they said we would wait and some so I went to ask how much longer. The guy who took my name/ info could not find me (maybe because he did not write me down) but pretended to have found me and said you are up next! Several minutes later they sat us in a small table and about half an hour later took our order and half an hour after that we got our food. They get three stars because I didn't expect great service at Fridays. Love their food though.

The service here has gone down as well as the quality of the food but I'm in love with their shrimp skillet the servers are still polite it's the food quality the drinks are watered down so I don't even order alcohol here anymore im paying for cups of colored I've water.

Good food for a late night menu. Its not a 5 star Beverly Hills restaurant, Its a Fridays you know what you are getting into. It is overall pretty clean and bathrooms are well kept. If you stick to the menu the pricing is exactly what you see. I am a fussy eater, therefore the prices shift depending on who takes the order. Which does not bother me but others may get bothered by this. You can still eat healthy here late night vs fast food burger places.
I enjoy their food and drinks but the service is way to slooooow!!  Their late night happy hr starts at 10pm but it gets way too crowded during the weekends.
OMGEEEE this place sux ! It was the spot back in the day, but now I don't even know what to say about it !  Hostess was rude, the wait was ridiculous, and drinks taste like juice !
I came here for some drinks and apps with a friend over at the bar area. The bartender rarely tended to us. Peculiarly, we were harassed to pay for our check several times.

Took a small group of 9, here today for the worst experience ever.  Food was ok but the service was horrible.  Who could guess that splitting the bill could be so painful.  I am local and eat out with friends most weekends but never again here.

The food-this is actually why you go EAT at a restaurant, right? B/c the food is good. When I want Michelin Star or Zaggat Rated shit I know where to go, so I'm not going to sit here and bitch about their food when it is actually pretty good for what it is.  The service-sucks for DAYS!!!!!! Food and attention take way too long. If you have time and aren't starving then order a drink and you won't get annoied.  The establishment- it needs some TLC.  Like I said, I don't go here expecting a Mastro's level experience. If you want that then save your pennies and make a reservation.

Came here with my gf last night to check out they're happy hour drinks/food. When we arrived we were seated pretty quickly even though it seemed pretty busy at the time. And were seated where we both were able to enjoy the entertainment of the football games which was pretty cool! So we both order the jack daniels burger and loved every bite of it! And the jack daniels sauce they provide just makes the burger that much better! We were going to order some appetizers since almost all of them are half off during happy hour! which is super cool but we knew that would of been too much food and even the waiter told us we would be overwhelmed with food and didn't want us to spend money on something we couldn't finish. That was really considerate of her :) But we did order the ultimate lemonade ;) and because it tasted so refreshing we decided to get another one haha. The service was very well played and very generous! So needless to say we will be back! And looking forward to trying out their appetizers!

This place is unethical & attempts to cheat your order by bringing less food.  Watch-out.  (I have to say, the servers are excellent, but it is awful that they have to deal with crappy management.) I ordered the Cobb Salad with Grilled Chicken Breast from the specials menu (the one at the back) for $5.99.  What was brought to me was a plate of iceberg lettuce, a strip of bacon, two slices of avocado, and 1/3rd of a chicken breast.  Okay, fine, it's a cheap special, but I asked the waitress for the rest of my chicken breast.  She stated, "The specials only come with half a chicken breast."  I pointed to the menu where it says "chicken breast" without mention of halfsies. She knodded and a few minutes later brought out a whole chicken breast.  Later, it appeared on my receipt as an additional charge of $2.99.  When I asked her about it, she said, "Oh he didn't take that off?"  She took care of it and I didn't have to raise a stink. I've done food service, too, so I suspect that the management cutting corners by cheating customers and making the servers deal with the backlash.  Shameful.  It's hard enough being a server.  I tipped that waitress 33%.  She was great, but I've never been to a TGIF and I will never be back.

Big mistake about coming here is expecting a delicious, appetizing meal. If you want dinner, I'd shell out the extra bucks to go somewhere else. Otherwise, this place is only good for appetizers and beer. Our waitress was very nice though.

***FOOD POISONING!!!*** I feel the need to get this warning out first, if you are considering giving this place a shot regardless of the rating DO NOT CHANCE IT!! Bf has been puking since 5am, it is the worst food poisoning we've ever seen, might go to ER if it doesn't stop in an hour! We know their food is the cause b/c we were so busy yesterday all we had were a donut each & dinner here. I read through some of the reviews and this is the 3rd food poisoning just here on yelp, prolly more that aren't mentioned here, the place is gross and staff irresponsible. Service sucks! Food was cold/sat too long, bland.  managers were nice. 0 stars if possible. There is the short gist of it.  Here is a more in depth explanation as to why this place deserves no stars and HOW my bf got sick, also the few good points if you're interested. Us: servers, long time in food indus. So understanding/easy to please, big tippers. Our experience at TGI Fridays in Torrance: Time of visit: 9:30ish pm Thursday 12/12/13. From what we could see at night our first impression was good, large parking lot, landscaping & outdoor fountains were nice. The place has great potential, too bad that initial impression didn't last. The entrance was deserted, the 1st employees we saw were in the back leaning and talking. No hostess around, once we found 1 we were seated quickly. Server: Sonia -10 min for initial greeting/drink orders. Drinks were brought in ok time. -when we asked for more time (1st time there) it took almost 15 min. for our order to be taken by the manager, server greeted/took orders for 2 nearby tables w/out looking at us 1ce in this time -10 min for side of ranch for app. that bus boy eventually got, same w/refilla except we waited 15-20 for those -mngr took and brought every order except dessert -server checked on us 1 time only & never brought napkins we asked for -45 min for simple entrees...the plates were burning hot but food was cold, that's a telltale sign it sat too long under heat lamps. We had time sensitive chicken/shrimp THIS is where bf got SICK, it was ill prepared and sat too long. she was nowhere in sight most of our meal, other tbls were impatient and 1 guy actually walked around looking for her to no avail. No friendliness or apologies, she needs both serving and service training. Food: my chicken was cold & dry had to use leftover pasta sauce to make edible, pasta cold and sticky. Bfs pasta was cold, sauce was congealed, shrimp/chicken cold. He didn't eat much of it and boxed the rest (thankfully he didn't touch the leftovers later) Dessert was good, vanilla bean chscake was awesome, app (flatbread) and dessert was best part of the meal. the manager melissa was nice & friendly, so wasthe busboy. When I called and spoke to Pia (other mngr) she was also nice, and was concerned about the food poisoning. She said she would tell her staff at their meeting tonight about it, but offered no other actions to prevent this from happening to some1 else, nor did she offer an incentive to come back (not that I would, or was looking for a freebie), this is normal protocol, you should also ask for customers info to check back on them. I will never come back or reccomend this place, do not try it, the rating is accurate, service and cleanliness are zero! And the food is dennys quality but more expensive! (Sry for the grammar I was trying to save space and I'm typing this on a small phone)

I went here for Lunch today and had a really good meal , I tried their garlic shrimp skillet, super recommend that dish if you like your food nice and hot ! Let me tell you that skillet keeps it reaal hot. My visit was just unpleasant because of the waitress,  she was very dry and serious, that just killed it for me... management should encourage their team to be a little bit more friendly and upbeat,   im sure that will bring more customers

I don't get the bad reviews... the staff has always been exceptionally (by TGIF standards) attentive and polite at this particular location. The food is always prepared to general TGIF standards, and they've never messed up an order. I LOOOVE that you guys still offer the endless lunch/dinner (which a bunch of locations have stopped serving for some reason). I come here very, very often for lunch and almost as often for dinner as I have a striped account with like 500 points lol. Overall, Friday's does not need an introduction, and this location is a great one (incomparable to the relatively hood locations around LA). My one complaint is the random (seriously..) rush of people during random weekdays... I think you guys are doing a great job!
I always like going to TGI locations and this one was also good. The food is always tasty to me and the servers are usually very attentive and helpful. This particular location is fairly spacey too.

This place is HORRIBLE! We came here last night to celebrate my dad coming home after being away on business for 3 months and we all regret it. We got sat quickly for a party of 6 but it wasn't busy at all. The server didn't come to greet us for about 15 mins and took our drink order. 1 coke and 4 flavoured lemonadeds took about 15 mins then our food order was taken. It took her another 20 mins to bring us our salads because she was too busy laughing it up and chatting with the busser a few tables over. She finally brought the salads, she forgot my dads salad! When we got our entrees, nothing was even hot! Our food was barely warm because laughing and talking is more important than her ONLY table. I wish gratuity wasn't automatically added to parties of 6 or more because she DID NOT earn her tip at all! Service and quality have DEFINITELY gone down since I worked here when I was younger. Complete disappointment and we will NEVER come here again!

Not sure about all the bad reviews. My boyfriend and I come to this place quite often over the past 5 yrs, never have had a bad experience. We do enjoy sitting at the bar at almost any restaurant we go to....closer to the booze. Almost every time we are there, we are waited on by Randy (the bartender). I cannot say anything bad about this guy, very kind, friendly and gives excellent service!!!

A great place to come and eat after long hours , my family and I come here often for a late snack :) service is just ok and it takes forever for your food to come out but the waiters are super friendly and the food is ok. I would recommend this to the people who work long hours and need a place to eat late at night:)

Okay I think it's time to write an update on this. Since my last review I've returned to Fridays quite a few times.  I've learned that the bar menu is actually really good (Ice cold beers on tap as well), and if you're going there on a date you can't go wrong with their pastas.  The food isn't 'bad,' it's just not something to write home about.  If you really want to get something GOOD expect to pay a bit more for it.  The ribs are very good. The chicken and shrimp pasta is my favorite!  But I only really look forward to going if I'm going with the bros. Then I don't mind getting a cold beer and some sliders. Which is where the magic of TGIs is.

EW!!!!!!!! i went here and my waitress was HORRIBLE and she had a runny nose and wiped her nose with her hand then served my food which was in her other hand. she then apologized after and said the reason she had a runny nose was because she was drunk with friends and ate it on the ground and therefore that gave her a runny nose? didn't enjoy my meal after i saw her snot all over.
Everything has pretty much been said about this place in the previous reviews: the good and the bad. My advice... Come here on the off hours -- everything is much better then.

WARNING DO NOT EAT HERE!!! Unless you want to end up in the hospital like i did. Typical TGIF restaurant. OK food, OK staff, OK service. I like their drinks more than the food. The best thing about this location is that it's not too far from the Del Amo AMC movie theater.

This review is for their takeout service. I ordered two grilled chicken chopped salads to go for lunch. On the phone they asked if I wanted the dinner or lunch size and I said lunch. When I got to my desk and opened my salad I was pretty annoyed. Yes, it is a lunch salad and $6.99, but there was very little food in the container. On top of the chopped romaine lettuce were: two over-cooked HALF pieces of bacon, two slices of grilled chicken, half a small avocado, half a very small boiled egg, four tiny cherry tomato halves and a tiny sprinkle of blue cheese. And the ingredients were just thrown on top of the lettuce. I've never seen anything so pathetic.  I could have gotten this at Quizno's if I wanted so little. I'll be hungry again in a hour. And, because I'm annoyed right now, I'll add - this is supposed to be a "chopped" salad. The ingredients are usually chopped - including the meat and bacon. I had to chop my chopped salad myself, LOL.  The service was fast and the staff is nice. But if they're going to do takeout, they shouldn't treat it so poorly - someone is still looking at the presentation and someone is still eating the food. There is no way they are serving this in the restaurant - I mean, I hope.

I don't come to TGI Fridays all that often and on a few recent visits, I remembered why - the service just isn't up to par and the food is average. The waiters and waitresses were very inattentive and didn't seem to care in the slightest about delivering good service. On one visits, I ordered a Jack Daniel's burger with "no pink." Some places the meat/burger temperature varies - medium well vs. well done, so I try to make it simple by just saying "no pink." When I received my burger, it was extremely burnt and tasted like I was eating a piece of charcoal. I sent it back, only to get a burger burnt in the same manner. I don't think anyone would be pleased with a burnt burger.... but they had no problem serving it me that way twice. The second time I came, I was pleased by only one thing - the Happy Hour drink I ordered. Their blue raspberry margarita was AMAZING - great flavor and a nice amount of alcohol, but not too strong. Plus, it being $5 was an added bonus! The rest of the dining experience that night was lackluster. We had a very rude server who took many of our plates before we were finished and constantly rushed us. And once again, the food was just average, nothing special, nothing that would make us eager to come back. I probably won't be coming back here unless its for their Happy Hour. Its just not worth spending hard earned money at a restaurant that doesn't value good service or serve great food. I'll go elsewhere.

This TGIF location is usually on point with everything, they have excellent customer service that's very attentive and courteous. The inside had a 3 tier set up, which i think is pretty cool. There's a good mixed crowd in here, not ghetto fabulous like the Compton location. One of the main reasons I come to TGIF Friday is for the spinach dip, it is finger licking good! However, I came today craving it, just so the waitress can tell is they ran out about an hour ago. It is barely 8 pm and they already ran out?! This is definitely not acceptable for such a big chain restaurant like this. Spinach dip is one of their most well known and wanted items on their menu. Management should be better stocked with one of their most popular appetizers, especially since it is Sunday! This is why this place is getting 2 stars!! Definitely not a satisfying feeling when you are told they are out of your favorite dish when you drive from 2 cities away!
I'm a fan of every Fridays resraturant except the magic Johnson Fridays off la Cienega in los angeles, that one is ghetto. But this one is nice and food was good!

Came here at about 11:30, waiting for less than 10 minutes to get seated, super fast. Parkings good, plenty of it.  So happened to be happy hour, came with 5 of my friends after watching Noah at Rolling Hills.  Margaritas were 5 bucks! Got a mango berry and I think I found my new favorite margarita. Fries and sliders are a buck fifty.  First off we got a shrimp cocktail with 12 pieces of shrimp, 5 bucks for happy hour. Usually 10. Brushetta, tuna crunch somethings and Angus scewers. The scewers were way too small, like 2 bite sized pieces of meat on a stick with pita bread. It was okay. We also got the bacon macaroni and cheese bites, were pretty good, same as any other Mac and cheese ball out there.  Also got the spinach artichoke dip, got the dip before the chips and the waiter said he was waiting on a fresh batch of chips, but the chips were very stale to me and seemed as if they put old chips into a deep fryer just to warm them up. Tastes like when you heat up a hard shelled taco or something in the microwave and it just doesn't taste fresh anymore.  Service was good and spent about 67 bucks on 6 people, 4 of which got drinks.

Great food (I had classic cheese burger & chicken and shrimp pasta)..... great costumer service .. Over all I'm satisfied .. reason being the 4 stars not 5 is because I kept asking for napkins and they kept forgetting and they wrap their forks and knives tooooooo tight with the napkin and tape.. I had such a hard time opening it that o accidently spilled my drink -_- they need more napkins on the table PLEASE.. that's all
I give this place 4 stars for the service. The waiter was amazing. Food was just right, drinks, and he smiled the whole time. The food was ok nothing to brag about.

Came here with two friends and must I say that the servers were really attentive that night. There was a party of about 14 next to us, so another server took our orders for a while, but the staff made sure that we were taken care of. Would have gave them a two star for food, but the  Their food is average.  The Mozzarella Sticks aren't good. They cheese inside is too mushy as if they took it out of the freezer and fried it quickly. We ordered a Angus Bacon Burger, the French Dip Sandwich and I had half a rack of ribs with broccoli and loaded mashed potatoes. My ribs were overly cooked :( so chewing them was a bit difficult, but the broccoli and mashed potatoes were pretty good.  My friend ordered a red velvet cake for dessert, and it was a bit too sweet for my tasting. We ended up not finishing it, which is a surprise because going with two guys and myself who have big sweet tooth's, that probably meant it wasn't much to our liking.

Had the most amazing experience here 4/26/2014 it was happy hour so I ordered wings jack Daniel and garlic Parmesan they were amazing also ordered nachos and a vodka cranberry the drink was strong just like I like it the staff was very friendly and so was the manager he started off by taking my order and finished by buying me and my daughter desert the most amazing experience yet !!!

This place.sucks!!! Its old and it smells like a dirty rag.i went there yesterday for lunch and got food poisoning! I had a Jack Daniels burger.within a few hours i had diarrhea and was throwing up the hamburger i had.yuck!!!  Im never going there again you shouldn't either if you don't wanna get sick.there kitchen and tables and floor look dirty!

I don't really know why people give this place such harsh reviews. I came here to watch the Belmont Stakes race and the Kings vs Rangers game.  TGIF has one of the best Happy Hours around because of price and variety. Not only do they have a large array of drink specials, but also food (1/2 appetizers). The grande nachos are great bar food with plenty to share. The BBQ chicken flatbread is also pretty good.  Plenty of TVs and great atmosphere. Almost the whole restaurant was watching the game- loud cheers and applause erupted every time the Kings scored.

This place has horrible service out of all the times coming here never has never been this bad in my experience here. Took 40+ minutes to get our appetizers and 1 hour later to ask if we want to order our entrées.
Haven't  been there in awhile. Never greeted by bartender. Left after 5 min after sitting there. Never getting acknowledged.

I went to Friday's for my niece Graduation celebration.  Ordered pecans crested chicken salad.  The chicken was awful , over cooked. Nothing crested about it. Bad choice on my part. The service was poor and the cook needs to learn to make the dishes on fhe menu

The Butler Did It Why read a book when you can go to the end and see the answer.  This is what you need to do with the menu at TGI.  There is a deal on the last page called 2 for $20.  You split an appetizer, get a full dinner with two sides for just $20.  Bargain.    Plus, the meal is very good.

Today's Friday's visit was a total fail...usually our food is good but not today! My boyfriend ordered a double stacked Philly Burger, meat was undercooked and fries didn't seem fresh at all! He couldn't finish his meal. My meal wasn't that great either, ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp. I pretty much spat out half of my food. Cheese, chicken and potatoes were weird. Even my margarita was lame, didn't seem like it had any alcohol. Get it together Friday's!

It's funny,  we go to TGIFs all the time in Cerritos because it's awesome but the one here in Torrance has a lot to be desired.  Occasionally I order the BBQ Chicken Flatbread and DEVOUR it because it's that good but this one here, eww.  And the Spinach Dip is great in Cerritos but what happened to this TGIFs?  The tortillas were thick and hard and had no taste at all.. hmm... let's get outta here..

If I could give a negative star I would!  Unfortunately I didn't get the waitress name (apparently she knew she was that horrible that she didn't give her name on purpose) My sister and I visited the torrance location on 7/16/2014 and were seated to the left side area near the kitchen. I had been fasting all day and was so ready for a good meal, something Fridays always delivers. but apparently today just wasn't the day for great food and customer service. My waitress was rude!
