The way I knew this was because I dipped my potato skin in the sour cream before she took my plate. And this sour cream on the 'new' plate had left over cheese and bacon from the potato skin I dipped. This tells me that the kitchen heated up my ENTIRE plate and tried to re serve me with it. THIS IS COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE! I have been with the board of health for over 5 years and this could cause a serious fine and/or investigation. I am utterly disgusted and will NEVER return to that particular Fridays.
Just really bad all around....had to leave. We ended up going down the street to olive garden.

Pleasantly surprised. Took my oldest per her request to this Friday's. I had previously sworn them off after several bad experiences. I wanted crab cakes was kinda worried cause my motto is "order what the establishment is known for", but they were good I have had better but good. The meals were the normal steak and mashed potatoes. Good for this restaurant.

terrible service...cold food. I worked at a Fridays for two years so I know what the food should taste like and what to expect...I understand it's not a 5 star restaurant, but this was terrible.  Also, our server ripped the survey receipt in half, I'm guessing so we couldn't do it even if we wanted to.  I timed this...she literally walked past our table a good 3-4 times but didn't stop by for almost 25 minutes.  I'm not exaggerating...I was going to order a drink before happy hour ended, and she didn't come to our table until 7:20.  I won't be returning to this location also, boneless wings took more than 20 minutes....I know this is the kitchen and not the server...but still annoying Oh and our server was chatting at the host stand when we left...not as in talking to them about work or seating or anything, but just friendly chatting...coincidence? I think not!

The hostess had us waiting without saying a word to us while she preped a table. After 5 minutes of non acknowledgement and us walking out..."How many in your party?" Went to Olive Garden instead...sheesh!
Food is good but service is low. Happy hour prices are descent.  This place is always busy and loud.

As many people have said before me, "if there could be a negative star, I'd give it" ! We've been sitting here for nearly 30 minutes and haven't even received out waters yet. It took our waitress 15 minutes just to get with us.  Our waitress seemed very unenthusiastic and her service is very slow.  Me and my family will definitely not be returning to this location. They put TGIF's reputation to shame. 08/14/14

I'll have to admit, there is a certain charm to being handed a drinks menu and hearing that familiar velcro-ish rip as you pull the pages apart knowing full well that there is no velcro on this menu it's just filthy. But I digress. lol Came in to kill an hour as my car was at the dealer across the street. I had a beer and fries and that is as high as I set my sights. It's TGI friday "it actually was Friday"  The fries and beer was good. I'd do it again in 3-6 months when I need to take my ride in for service.  Cheers.

If you order the $10 endless appetizer- u wait forever in between plates. It wasn't crowded either just bad service all around and uncomfortable seating. Half booths only and broken that lamps outside. Expensive too.

My first time at that location and it wasn't very good! I like the brand "Friday's" and have gone to several different ones for happy hour! At this one the bartender girl was NOT friendly AT ALL! Sour look on her face, annoyed with every person she encountered! And the service was HORRIBLE! I had to come to the bar area to ask for a drink myself, the counter where I was sitting was dirty and sticky! The couple that sat next to me had to wipe their counter section just like I did, no one serviced them either so the wife had to go order the drinks and bring them herself as I did. I got out of there as quick as I could and won't go back to that location again. I gave it a two because the drink and happy hour is the same as other locations and just as I thought it would be.

Haven't been to this location in quite awhile. If memory serves me correct it was just ok the last time. Thought I would give it another try as I remember years ago this place use to be pretty good--drinks and food. Came in for happy hour Tuesday and was quite surprised there were only a couple people in the place @ 5:30. I'm pretty sure I know why now. This place has literally taken a nose dive!!  The drinks were terrible (nothing like they use to be). The appetizers were disgusting. Was going to order an entree but didn't dare. Also the booths were probably the same ones I sat in in the early 90's when I use to frequent this place. I was literally sitting on a vinyl covered 2x4. No discernable padding whatsoever. What a complete and total dump. Really sad to say because this place use to be a great spot. Stay away !!! Far Away !!!

I was disappointed with their ahi appetizer and tomato basil soup, especially for the price. Wanted to try something different, I should have stuck with the bar food like the Jack Daniels burger and ribs. Those are always good.
Horrible experience! They need to close it down. Waited 20 min for menus. Rude employees. Never again I rather starve! The service is like the women that work there HORRIBLE!
Came in with my girlfriend and found out it was happy hour all day for football season +$3 bottle beer ! Our server was Tyler and she was the best server we've ever had! Will be back next game!

This was my favorite restaurant and location. I will never be eating here again!!!! The waitress was rarely seen. I took my mom there for her birthday, we let two waiters know that it was her birthday and no one came to sing her happy birthday!!!! I ordered the summer chiller drinks that are supposed to come in a mason jar. and the waitress brought me my drink and it was in a regular glass. she said they ran out of the glasses!! Our experience at this location has been the worst for the past couple months!!! I will never be returning to this location!!!!! EVER!!!!!!

Ordered my fav burger and to my surprise I received the blue cheese burger. Seeing as how I was in a rush and I love blue cheese I let it slide.  The server was nice enough to comp my meal except beer.  I now have a new favorite burger although it would be nice if wait staff was more attentive at the start.  I will be back. Good burgers/salads cooked to my specifications (well done) and Newcastle on tap ! Win win.   Wait wasn't bad at all for a Saturday night.  My only true complaints are messed up order and cleanliness of bathroom. I doubt the pee smell will ever leave my shoes.

We got a really nice server who was able to accomodate our big group. I got the garlic basil bruschetta and my friends got the chicken wings. I think there is nothing extraordinary with their food but it is still good and a comfortable place to hang out and have a late dinner. Throught out the night I noticed that our server did not come back to refill our drinks and even forgot to give us utensils. It didn't seem like it was pretty busy. Customer service is so so

Horrible service.  1st the host was completely rude and when asked a question she walked away from us after we asked twice for a table for 2.  2nd no one ever came up to us after about 10 minuets so we just walked out.  I work in a restaurant and I know when I'm dealing with a lazy and rude host (young blonde girl with a bun) and no where to be found servers.  HOWEVER, the bartender was beyond nice, had my friend not forgotten her ID we would of had a great time, we had our drinks in less than a minute and our order was taken right after. Only reason I'm giving 2 stars is for him.

Nothing out of this world & they can be a bit disorganized but they get 4 stars because of the $10 endless app promo going on right now. I get spinach artichoke dip with fresh corn tortilla chips ( ) & my son gets the endless boneless wings. Honestly the wings are the best deal- a 6 piece boneles combo is almost $10 at wingstop & it's not endless so at 8 wings coming out at a time u really get your $'s worth. Garlic parmesan, buffalo, bbq, atomic they're all awesome & you can change up the flavors each time.

I had stopped coming to this place for about 2 years because I wasn't satisfied with the food. I decided to give this place another try and I'm so happy that I did! I ordered the half rack of ribs & lobster tail, I chose loaded mash potatoes and mac N cheese as my sides. I asked for the lobster tail grilled and it was perfect!! I could have ate 5 of those things. Now the ribs were a tiny bit on the dry side and weren't as "fall off the bone" as they make it seem but I devoured them anyway and I did enjoy them. Good job on stepping up your food game, Fridays! I'll definitely be back.
Thank you for gifting me a free meal on Veterans' Day.  I really appreciate your generosity.  Today is my favorite day of the year.  From a grateful veteran.

Wow, not good at all.  Busy Friday night, flatbread pizza arrived cold, we sent it back for hot.  It never arrived.  Buffalo wings had a long black hair in it, we let the manager know about it sweetly.  They were very accomodating and comped us a free dessert, which was cool because we split a delicious hot brownie sundae between us.  I think they may have been understaffed, our poor server was seriously in the weeds.  My friend really liked her mudslide, and the wings before the hair was discovered.  Know what I mean?  Maybe try during a less busy time.

Went for a quick bite after peak hrs so serv was better. Ordered cpl drinks but bar was way too slow, unacceptable (where are U manager?). Our waiter was very nice, even though he was the only one around.  Ordered 3 unlimited appetizers: boneless buffalo wings, mozarella sticks and mahi mahi on a chip?  If it wasn't for the advertised specials this branch would go belly up. And I have been to several TGIFs.
The food was good but sooooo greasy. Your hamburger shouldn't drip when you pick it up. Not pleased.

this mother loving place...... I ordered a burger , yup a single goddamn burger and it took more than  40minutes.  I couldn't even ask my waitress because she also disappeared for 40minutes I walked up to the host and told her that we've been waiting for long time  and she was like "uhh,..... ok...... Let me check..... (with attitude) When the food arrived it was all dry... and cold... I would give 0 star if I can  I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE !! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
$5 average appetizer price during happy hour = an awesome feast. Best wait staff around!!! So friendly.

Usually come here randomly at night after working. Sometimes there's a line, but most of the time we can get seated right away. And since we always come late night, means half priced appetizers.  Always loved the appetizers here, just I never felt justified in paying the regular price they have for them for what you get. It's almost the same price as a meal.  Food and drinks are always brought out in ample time and never disappoints. And the alcohol selection is pretty good too. Just a little noisy at times, when they have some good games on.

location: South East LA, Los Angeles, CA
review: I'm a regular here, I have never had bad service. It's been busy but never have been treated bad or poorly. We always get Sonia, she's amazing! She always treats us good. The manager is so friendly, don't know his name but I have seen him more than once and he has always greeted us. I don't know why this place isn't rated better. This is the best TGIF I've been at.

My first TGI Friday's experience was on a Saturday after work. I was tired, hungry and ready for some good food. This location in particular was pretty close to an Olive Garden, so I was hoping that, even though my boyfriend and I were headed to the restaurant during prime dinner hour (6:30 p.m.), that more people would be flocking to the home of unlimited soup, salad and breadsticks than to Friday's.   We ended up waiting about 20 minutes to be seated--not as bad as it could be, for a weekend--and the inside of the restaurant was definitely noisy. Because we were only a party of two, we were squeezed into one of the smaller tables in between all the larger parties.   There's a great selection on the TGI Friday's menu (and if you go during Happy Hour or on Fridays, there's better deals, of course). I had an overall good experience, as the appetizer we ordered was delicious, and I couldn't have enjoyed my meal and dessert more. I think our dessert was the highlight of the meal (more on that below). I can't remember what my boyfriend ordered, but here are some of our selections from the night, as well as some of the entrees I was considering and will probably try on a future visit:   "Loaded Potato Skins": I love baked potatoes, but I also love their sister food - crispy, loaded potato skins. This appetizer features crispy potato skins topped with melted cheddar and crispy applewood smoked bacon, and is served with green onion sour cream. I enjoyed my potato skins perfectly fine without the sour cream. Each skin was nice and crispy, covered with the oozing, melted cheddar. The crispy bacon pieces provided additional crunch and flavor, and though this appetizer was greasy, it was extremely savory and helped to stave off my hunger until my entrée came.   "Bacon Mac & Cheese Bites": I'm a sucker for anything that involves mac & cheese, and when you add bacon to the mix ... well, bacon really does make most things better. I haven't tried this dish (under the "Taste and Share" section of the menu), but it sounds mouthwatering. This small plate includes crispy bites filled with three varieties of Cheddar and is served with a craft beer cheese dipping sauce. Each order comes with only four balls, so if you're a mac & cheese fanatic, you might want to get more than one order (unless you're set on not sharing).   "Sizzling Chicken & Cheese": The entrée I ordered on my first trip to TGI Friday's tasted as flavorful and delicious as it sounds. It comprised garlic-marinated, all-natural chicken breast served over melted cheese with onions and peppers and served with creamy mashed potatoes. I ordered my entrée without the onions and peppers, but the chicken had enough taste with its garlic flavor and all the cheese. I was happy to see that they did not skimp on the cheese, either. The mashed potatoes were light and fluffy and the perfect accompaniment to the cheesy chicken.   "Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie": During my first and only visit to TGI Friday's, I did have the chance to try this dessert, and it was absolutely phenomenal. This dessert features chocolate ganache layered with peanut butter mousse in a peanut butter graham cracker crust. It's topped off with whipped cream and a peanut butter cup. When I ordered this dessert, I got it sans the whipped topping (but with the peanut butter cup), and it was amazing. I usually don't like mousse, but for peanut butter, I'll always make an exception. The dessert was a creamy blend of both chocolate and peanut butter, and the peanut butter graham cracker crust was delectably unique.   "Brownie Obsession": I love cookies and brownies, so if it weren't for the "Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie" that was on the menu, I probably would have gone with this dessert. This sweet treat features a warm, chocolate fudge brownie topped with vanilla ice cream, pecans and Ghirardelli caramel sauce. Though this brownie dessert sounds pretty standard, I don't need anything super fancy. If it simply involves a moist brownie, ice cream and lots of good chocolate, I'm happy.   "Oreo Madness": There are so many choices on the dessert menu that it's hard to settle on just one. I have to admit, I paid some attention to this classic cookies and cream dessert, even when I had settled on the "Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie" as my choice. This decadent delight includes Cookies 'n Cream ice cream sandwiched between layers of an Oreo cookie crust and garnished with Ghirardelli chocolate sauce. Yummmmmy. This dessert is truly a cookie lover's ultimate.

I have eaten at this restaurant with my family quite a few times and the food was fine. We usually had the baby back ribs and they were fine, but the last time we ate there the vegetables were horrible, you could barely chew them, just nasty and that spoiled our whole meal. I told the server and they did absolutely nothing about it, they could have offered me a different side order but they didn't.  I sent in my feedback to the restaurant via email and the next day the manager called me and apologized for the bad veggies but he had a slight nasty attitude (not friendly at all, a real jerk) then he proceeded to ask me if I still had the receipt from when I dined there. I told him no so he starts questioning like Im lying or something and asking me are you sure you came here. I told him this conversation is over and I  didn't appreciate him talking to me they way he did. I will never eat at this location in Torrance again. They need to fire his smart ass. He had no customer service skills at all. A total jackass. Where is Donald Trump when you need him to say "YOURE FIRED!!! lol

My burger was dry and burned.  My service was mediocre.  My artichoke dip was chunky and cold.  My fries were soggy.  Didn't get anything I asked for.  Had to ask 4 different people for 4 different things.  What a waste of a Sunday brunch.

Came here for dinner on a Sunday night, never again will we be eating here. Not only did my friend find a huge piece of plastic in her food, there was a long piece of hair in my mash potatoes!  I use to come here all the time about 5 years ago.... Man has this place changed! Everything was so sloppy and again.... Plastic AND hair in our food. Sorry TGIFRIDAYS but you just lost a few customers.

NO COMPLAINTS... Went here last night with my bf 1.4.15 for late late dinner and the place was pretty dead.  We got greeted upon entry and were seated right away. The waiter came over started us of with drinks and was attentive the entire time.  I will be backsoon

NEEDS NEW MANAGEMENT!!! Only reason I'll ever come here is for there Jack Daniel's Rib-Eye steak! This is my favorite plate here,  Customer service is horrible, very slow service. and they charge $1.99 for playing a game on the touch screen pad the have on the tables.  My experience: I walk in ask for a table of two, in less than 5 minutes the have us seated. Our waiter comes and hands us our menu, 10 minutes later she takes out drink order - we order food as well; about 15 - 20 minutes later she finally brings us drinks; then about 40 minutes from that my food arrives COLD! But of course, since I've been waiting all this time starving, I eat it cold because I can't wait any longer for them to reheat it! Not only is the service slow! but the employee's are so rude and lazy! while I'm sitting down I see three girls in a corner talking for 20 minutes.. seriously, they need new management, better employee's who want to work and serve! Not these waiters who look like they are drop outs of high school and hate there jobs - Hopefully one day this location gets rid of all these lazy employees and betters there service.

As a yelper, I should be slightly ashamed of myself for going to a restaurant before checking reviews. (This was our first time here btw) My wife (newlywed!) ordered the jack chicken and shrimp... but she's on a very strict diet and couldn't have the sauce. She forgot to mention that, so when the (seemingly) friendly waitress brought our food... we had to ask her if we could just have another piece of chicken minus the sauce. My wife apologized for failing to mention that beforehand, but the waitress was visibly agitated and her entire demeanor changed. She brought the food, but didn't say anything after that... wouldn't visit anymore nor would she talk to her like she first did either. She was playing 20 questions in regards to our marriage and was excited for us and all that stuff servers do to butter you up for good tips, but she wouldn't really even acknowledge us anymore after the order mistake. She took the silverware with the plate as well so I had to find her to ask for a refill on my coffee and for new silverware... which agitated her more. So we didn't want to order anything else just to prevent her from having to talk to us anymore. She also added that $1.99 game bill on the little tablets on their table that we never asked for. We used it to look at the desserts and we were charged $2 for video games? Pros: Service was somewhat quick.  Restrooms appeared to actually be clean. Our waitress attempted to be nice.. (attempted) Cons: Waitress was only nice for better tips (and it showed) Service become terrible after the previously explained 'one' bad encounter Hidden $2 fees on your check for video games when you view desserts Most likely will not be returning - not simply because of that server, but because it's an over-priced burger place with fast-food style shrimp... and the robbery that is $2 for menu-viewing. lol

Sat at the bar after work tonight. Shared  Mozzarella sticks with a friend. We both had cold mozzarella. Tasted horrible. Bartender did not apologize. Bad service, bad food, no flavor, not hot, not acceptable. Not coming back again.

Used to be my after work happy hour place years ago ~ back then - service was good & food was decent - drinks were great! I hadn't dined here for almost 10 years but just recently dined here for lunch with some friends from school. Currently, they offer a $10 dine & drink special. You pick an entree & a beverage (alcoholic options available). Service was good. Everyone ordered the spicy cheeseburger & a beer. The food was meh - wasn't bad but wasn't spectacular. Overall decent/good lunch experience.

Usually you would have to hog tie me screaming & squirming to go to TGIF, but I wanted to attend the birthday dinner for a dear friend who insisted on going to mediocre Americanized chain restaurants such as BJ's, Cheese Cake Factory, Chilis, Lazy Dog, etc.  So I put aside my pride in going to good tasting places to eat for this evening, and girded my loins in anticipation for some really bad food.   I ordered the Pork rib & flame grilled lobster combo.  Just to make sure I asked the waiter to make sure the lobster was kissed only lightly by the flame for only a short duration since I was sure they were going to nuke that puppy into a lobster rubber jerky.  To my surprise, the lobster came out moist, rich with basted butter with a slight char that added to the flavour of the white crustacean meat.  The pork ribs were a touch dry & no masterpiece of faux barbequing, but they were edible. A dash of Tabasco sauce even livened up the meatiness of the  pork ribs a bit.   The Coleslaw with julienned apples actually tasted fresh, crisp, with the right amount of sweet vinegar dressing. None of that heavy mayonnaise, soggy. limped out, tired mess. The Mac & Cheese was made of al dente Penne pasta that looks like Mostaccioli with fine parallel ridges going lengthwise along the pasta which was fine. But the mac & cheese was overly dry with a hardened crusty, oily yet bland cheese. The cooks making this should taste their own cooking as punishment for such dismal fare.  (I'm taking this home and doctoring it up with sautéed garlic, onions, bacon, cream, touch of cognac, shavings of Parmigiana Reggiana and then adding a bit of Black Truffle Oil at the end to add that acidic, woodsy, fermenting humus mushroom bouquet.)   Ice Tea was the preferred pairing. I was most impressed with our waiter whose name might be Mark, short dark brown hair cut, about 5'8", trim looking college student material.  He was most pleasant, and served out the food as fast as it came out to our large group.  Then he provided us with a list of what we had ordered, and all we had to do was tick off what we had ordered so that he could go to the trouble of calculating individual checks. Such a nice guy volunteering to go to all that trouble with a smile at 11 o'clock at night.  3-- Yelp stars for the food, but 5 Yelp star service.  Thanks for the nice, enthusiastic service. PS  I went to the Simi Valley branch years ago after theatre, and I find that some of their mixed drinks are fine.  I had one that looked like an alcoholic version of a strawberry ice cream parfait that really tasted great for dessert. So the  mixed drinks may be the way to go at TGIF's.

In the past I always associated TGIFriday's with mixed drinks. Perhaps their name is synonymous with Happy Hour, perhaps it was the lip-licking libations.  Now I go for the food (with at most a beer) because it stands up on its own!  I enjoyed a plate of 3 types of ribs with a monster baked potato and veggies - enough for 2 meals! I also tried a few small dishes - the Spicy Thai mini tacos with Sriracha and the Mac and cheese bites. I loved the complimentary flavors of the tacos and the size was perfect to sample or share. The Mac and cheese bites were definitely tasty comfort food but not the best ones I've had.  I have only experienced friendly staff who are eager to get the order right. TGIFriday's has so many options and fast service so I can't wait to return on any day!

Worst experience at a restaurant ever. First off I told the waiter I wanted bacon on the side of my potato skins instead of actually on them, she screwed that up. Ordered our food, wait time... 45 minutes. Had to remind them to give me a refill a few times and when I got my food well that's the worst part about it. I ordered some sort of Parmesan chicken with Mac & cheese. The chicken was dry as hell, flavorless and tiny. The Mac was okay. Had to salt and pepper it down to get a taste. The waiter was really sweet tho. I can't see why anyone would prefer this place over Chilis. Do yourself a favor, don't bother coming here. Save your coins.

I've been to this place a few times to make sure I was not there at a bad time. That doesn't seem to be the case. The food looks amazing on the menus but is just below average in taste and quality. The staff is polite and very helpful but the food is just not very good.  I truly believe that this location is not so good as it attracts very loud and inconsiderate obnoxious patrons. I can't imagine any restaurant can control who is coming in, but for me, 3x and I'm out.
Horrible!!!! Ordered food and drinks and we had to walk out because it took forever! Our waiter sucked. And it's dirty. Menus were sticky. Floors were not swept.

Ok so here's the deal, I had a dinner with my best friend and her 1 year old son. We got there at 4:30pm long story short we had to wait 45 minutes just for our server to serve us and then our drinks instead of taking a short time to bring it, it took her almost another 45 minutes for our drinks just for a refill and just for my friend to get her martini she always had an excuse that she was being held back but the restaurant wasn't crowded at all. I pressed the "call server" button no one came. Then finally our appetizers came out with another waitress. Another hour passed, it took the waiter another 45 minutes or maybe longer just to ask us what we wanted to get for entrees she then had the same excuse of being held back, again there is barely anyone at the restaurant. But when we asked for our dessert to go and some boxes it took her only 2 seconds to get them. I would never want to be going to a poor customer service place like this again it took 3 hours just to wait our tables. My food didn't taste so great and my friends food didn't taste that great either along with the martini she order it was really really strong and awful. I honestly wouldn't come back to this restaurant, poor service, lack of seeing what the customers need, rude, reasons why I gave them one star if only I can give them none. They need to hire those who are jolly, nice, friendly and those who doesn't take forever just to serve someone. What's the point of copying STACKED with the electronic menu if that shit doesn't work!

A Saturday family-night dinning experience was ruined by horrible service. After waiting 40 mins for our food to arrive the manager came over to offer us 25% off the bill which ordinarily would be a nice gesture; however prior to this acknowledgement the waitress who took our order had passed us on numerous occasions and not once stopped to check on us. We were seated in a location that she had to continually pass in order to service other guests. My three year old began to cry because he is not accustomed to waiting such a long time when dining out. When asked for a drink refill, prepare to wait another 15 minutes to HEAR that the drink will be out soon. Needless to say, don't go for dining when hungry, thirsty or with small children. You'll definitely leave more irritated than satisfied.

Now I love Fridays...For the over-all experience that is It's a place that just about any city I arrive in I can depend on a DECENT meal, a good drink and some people watching. Of course some are better than others and for different reason. I love the one in view park for socializing and drinks well... actually, the food is above average as well (for a TGIF) so pretty much everything.... except..... the wait. So... at-least from my experience this one rarely gets too crowded we went in with a party of four on a Saturday at around 4:30 and was able to be seated in less than 5 minutes and though there were a lot of empty tables( so the 5 minute wait must of been from under staffing) our waitress seemed flustered until I asked her was she having a bad day and then she changed her tune a bit. I had the Jack Daniel's sirloin steak w/ mashed potatoes and mac n cheese yes, I skipped the veggies... for fear that they would come out soggy and I like mines steamed just a bit or sautéed with butter and garlic, plus I just really just wanted both, the other orders were the bruschetta chicken pasta and the fire (something) salmon. ALL of the meats came out way to done and a bit dry. I was surprised how well done my sirloin came out, since when I use to order it this way the chef seem to think I meant other wise and left some pink as if it was better for me or something... but, now I'm learning better and the reasoning behind it. My sauce was a bit on the sweet side for my taste and I didn't like the dry bird crumbs.. I mean bread crumbs on the mac n cheese to me it was like a gourmet Kraft mac n cheese and it didn't come in the cast iron skillet like it was suppose to, though the waitress said I got more because of it. Everyone did eat all of there food so I guess it was good enough but definitely could have ben better. My bf did get the veggies and they were surprisingly fresh and crisp looking so next time lol. I normally get there spinach dip and breadsticks which I've always enjoyed Thank god I didn't we vouched for the Brownie sundae instead. all in all like the rating everything was just A-OK who knows if the meat was had a bit more Love maybe this would have gone up half a star or so.

Came here for my boyfriends birthday weekend and the experience was horrible. The food took nearly 2 hours and to top it all off it was cold! And the waitress gave very bad service. Didn't even give us napkins like come on! Its common sense

We were very unsatisfied with our take out order, my husband got an appetizer which required some additional sauces, HE GOT NONE. And his Appetizers were over cooked as well. And the servers didn't comprehend well. This services was terrible, my husband said we should have went to Chilis...

Mixed reaction. In the past we have had issues with very slow service at this TGIF. This time the server was great and the issue was the food. First I asked for a med well steak and what I got was red, soggy and tough. The vegetable wad good, but I had ordered a salad. They did fix the error rapidly. They also did offer to cook the meat longer but my experience has been that it usually will come back worse. I guess I will just go to outback or black angus when I want a steak.

I came here for a friend's birthday. The service was horrible. The waitress brought us drinks but never came back to take our food order even though we were a party of 8+. I will never eat at this location again. I can actually say Compton and Ladera are better.

Endless appetizers... More like endless hassles! It's suppose to be $12 per person and all U can eat appetizers. Well we have been waiting for over an hour, complained to the manager and my kid got cold fries with his burger. And still the appetizer I ordered and my friend order still hasn't come. Ridiculous

Although their main food isn't anything spectacular, I keep coming back here for the prices and the Happy Hour specials.  I joined the Friday's Rewards program so I keep getting free meals and/or discounts off my check.  You can also get free appetizers, usually chip and salsa, if you just show your card.   I usually frequent here on Sunday's because this is the few places that have Happy Hour all day on Sunday.  Cheeseburger Sliders are $1.50 each and appetizers are 1/2 off.  Service is usually hit or miss and I've had a couple of misses over the years.  Burgers are good, wings are better than BWW, steaks are not bad, ribs I wouldn't touch.  Wish they would have early check-in / call ahead on their app like BJ's, would make me come here more, sometimes the wait can be over 30 minutes.

Me and my husband got seated at 7pm. we ordered our drinks, appetizer, and food all at the same time. We got our appetizer and drinks right away. We saw the waitress walk by us like 6 or 7 times but wasn't coming with our food. Finally at 7:53pm she says let me go check your order. She comes back to say that our order was never put in and that she forgot what we ordered if we could tell her again. She then said that we still had yo wait 20 mins in order to get our food. At this point I was frustrated and said I was leaving. She then said OK but u have to pay for the drinks at least. I was in shock! After having us wait an hour to get our food she still had me pay for the drinks. She saw us there without our food every time she would pass by our table but never bothered to check on our food until an hour later. I love going to tgif but We will never be going back to this location. Horrible service!!!!!!

I love coming here for happy hour sitting at the bar only though! Every time I sat in diner area with my family it's extremely filthy :(  Overall I love the food , waiters are usually very attentive and nice .  They just need to hire someone to clean cause I been coming here for 10 yrs and the floor is always filthy!

I use to love this place but after tonight its probably my last meal here. Today was supposed to be a good night on Mothers Day.. I decided to meet my parents here at Fridays because the food is good and the service is always friendly. Our waitress was rude and hardly came to our table. My parents ordered food but had to wait a while to eat it because they were not given any silverware. The second time "Courtney" our waitress decided to come to our table she asked if we needed boxes but we were in the middle of eating..She never came to refill our drinks or ask us for anything else... To top it all off the restrooms look and smell like a park restroom..Fridays is no longer on my list of places to go to eat food or watch games...Word of advice if Courtney is your waitress be prepared to receive the worst service...
My friend got a beer denied because he is a tourist and didn't have a US ID, stupid shit ever, racist as people, you can not have a beer of you don't have a US ID

75 minute wait on a Friday evening. When the order arrives, fries are cold. Ok, so asked for fresh fries. 10 minutes later, sorry. The kitchen is really backed up and it will be awhile. In the meantime, everyone has finished their burgers already. Also, asked for a side of ranch. 15 minutes later, and after asking 3 times. It enentually shows up. Of course, by then the burger is cold. Been here 2 hours, so far. Seems they can't handle a packed restaurant. Waitress was apologetic, but that doesn't make up for cold food. In the end, they took 20% off the food. So, 2 stars goes up to e - for the effort to make things right.

TOURISTS INFORMATION: They DO NOT accept ID's from foreign countries! Me and my buddies came last night for a drink and left empty handed after they refuse to accept my identification card(s) (picture, date of birth etc - all there and in english!).  It was my third time there (both first and second time I "passed" with my exact same ID card) and my buddies and I won't be back or recommend this place to anyone.  We went from there to Redondo Beach pier and it was all fine.

I can see why this place has so little stars.  My food was so bland.  I had to put the black beans and Tabasco in my fajitas enable to eat it. At least hubby's baby back ribs were good.  At least he ate well.  That's all that matters.

When my family and I came here today we were seated pretty fast which was a plus, and our waiter made sure to get our drinks.  Once it was time to order entrees I ordered the Cajun shrimp chicken pasta because it was a favorite on the menu ($14.99), and my Dad ordered the Jack Daniel's steak and lobster ($29.99). Once our waiter got down our order it was literally a 45 minute wait, and once everyone's order came they let me know that my pasta would be out soon. I waited another 15-10 minutes for my pasta, which was a total hour wait for me. At this point I was starving, and expected the food to be pretty divine. In all honesty, I was already disappointed because my Dad's $30 dish looked dry and bland, which he agreed.  Once my pasta finally arrived, I took a bite and I was so sad. When I ordered Cajun I expected a kick of spice, but it did not have any. The pasta tasted more like Alfredo than Cajun.  Once it was time to pay, our bill came up to about $94.66, but I gave two stars for our waiter who made my pasta on the house for the wait. I was looking forward to eating here, but it took too long for our food to arrive, and unfortunately the quality of the food was disappointing, especially for the price.

I came here late last night with my family. The food was very bad and a bit pricey for the quality. I ordered a salmon dish which tasted like rubber, very dry and flavorless. My sons mac and cheese was cold, we sent it back and when they brought the second one, surprise! It was cold again! The waitress offered to bring a third one.... No thanks, just the check!

We had terrible service here. We waited a whole hour before silverware was even placed at our table. Our food came after another family who had arrived after we did. The waiter was friendly but they messed our oder up really bad. Would not recommend to anyone. Sorry but I was not happy here. We got put in the back corner all cramped and got served last and our food was messed up. Will not be coming here again.

To start off, the place was really organized, & the server my friend & I had, was very assertive & very attentive with us. The service and food were both great would definitely recommend. Our server Mike was also very funny & we overall think there should be more customer service exactly like his. Good job, Mike.

Surprised to see all the negative comments. We were just passing through the area and decided to stop here since we had some Stripes points to use. The hostess was very friendly and seated us quickly.Our waiter was very friendly. Got our drinks fast. With our Stripes card, our waiter brought us complimentary chips and salsa, Ordered steak, a double stack burger, and a kids chicken meal. Received our food under 15 minutes. Everything was cooked perfect and was delicious. We always share our food, so he brought us extra plates. We went in on 6-20-15 which was the day before Father's Day. After getting a box for our leftovers, he brought my husband a free sundae with 3 spoons. Very happy with the service and the place was clean. As a bonus, the area around the restaurant was beautifully landscaped with small rock waterfalls. Perfect picture spot to capture Father's Day. If we are ever in this area again, will definitely be back.

We experienced an awful Father's day here at this location.  The customer service was so bad, i will never patronize this location again even for free food!.  After a hefty 30 minute wait,  we were seated with a server who didn't seem happy to be there. He started off by leaving 6 used glasses at our table when bringing refills to 3 people! Finally I spoke with a supervisor to have the glasses removed and she says "Hes really busy and he cant be in two places at once".    Wtf!!!!!!  I could swear that was why there was a wait time right!? After she reluctantly romoved our used glasses she spills water all over my burger. By this time, im frustrated and ready to leave. To make a long story short,  she didn't replace my burger, she was rude when i confronted her about it and the GM Jimmy was an asshole also. Not sure how the management took a turn for the worst but You guys need to retrain everyone on courtesy! !
Great time, good food, but the drinks are watered down. Waitress was great, friendly, and on point with are loud big group. Will be back.

We enjoyed a relaxing and fun evening at T.G.I.F. in Torrance. We received outstanding service from Beverly. She's a rock star! Today was all-day happy hour and the food was yummy. The Mango Margarita was amazing and refreshing. Drop in and check it out=)

If anyone from corporate can read this, please be aware that this place is super dirty.  The floor in the main dining room are not swept.  We were seated and there were food on the floor and on the seats.  Even worse, the bathrooms were a complete mess.  There was water on the floor, one bathroom was out, the sink had water all over the place and the trash was overflowing.  The faucets were so grimy that you needed a tissue to turn on the water.  Gosh please help this place

Eh. I feel like this a place you should only come for drinks and appetizers. I thought the $10 all you can eat appetizers was a good deal in theory...but turns out it's 10 for refills on one appetizer.... For any appetizer in $12 per person. Now... Unless you are planning on having a stomach ache or you are super drunk...does not sound like a good idea. Might as well go can kbbq lol. Anyway... I came here for a friends birthday because he loves the jack Daniels stuff.... Shared the half rack of ribs and lobster w/ coleslaw and Mac and cheese. It was nice that they split everything on two plates without being asked... But all of our food was obviously either put under a heat lamp for a while or microwaved. My coleslaw was hot. Like lukewarm soup hot. The ribs were super super dry w/ sauce thrown on the top only and the lobster was slightly over cooked...good flavor but extremelyyyyyyy salty. Mac and cheese was good minus the 2 tablespoons of bread crumbs they tossed on top. Also tried some of my friends spinach dip.... It was alright. Didn't look too appetizing...again you could tell it had been sitting for a while probably under a heat lamp because the top had slightly crusted over and changed color.  Idk if getting older is making me a chain restaurant snob but I just was not feeling it at all. Waitress was nice but took w whileee to come around to our party of 20. Imo....stick to bar food and drinks here.

The waiters and waitresses are all very friendly and care about their costumes however the atmosphere is old and filthy. The food is not the best. All in all, I would say if it wasn't for the nice staff I would give this place 1 star. Really needs an upgrade

Happy hour SUCKS!!!!! You can only order certain appetizers..... tried to order the onion soup dumplings and they said that I couldn't, only if I ordered from the endless apps IM LIKE WTF????! GIVE ME WHAT I ASKED FOR! Oh and the black bartender is an asshole and never ask if he can help you. YOUR FIRED!!!!!

I do not go to chain restaurants very often, but I went to TGI Friday's on July 30th, 2015 for dinner with a friend.  We decided to try the all you can eat appetizers for $12. There are actually two options that you can choose from for all you can eat appetizers. It's either $10 for all you can eat of the same appetizer or $12 for all you can eat of several on their list. We chose the $12 option and I have to say that this is definitely the right thing to do. The appetizers were pretty good for a chain restaurant. The restaurant was pretty full when we arrived (It was about 6pm) but we did not have to wait at all. The service was decently fast and nice. The restaurant shares a very large parking lot with other places, but it seems to be pretty easy to find a spot (we did not have any problem). Overall, my experience with TGI Friday's was positive and I would recommend it. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

Came in on a Tuesday for dinner and overall the experience was subpar. As soon as we walked in, the hostess and the server neither greeted us nor smiled at us and did not look happy to be there.     Then while ordering my dad asked if there was an additional charge to change his side order from fries to a baked potato which the server said 'no' only to find out they did in fact charge us.     Throughout our meal our server did not check up on us and we couldn't even get his attention until halfway through our meal.      As we received our check our server had circled the suggested gratuity section and drew a smiley face next to it expecting us to tip him well. (He also circled the suggested gratuity on both credit card slips as well).           Not even a second after we signed the check he took the slip back waiting to see what we tipped.      Two stars for the food which by no means was extraordinary but was the better part of the evening.         As a server myself their customer service needs some serious adjustment and they could make more effort to change their attitudes.
Food is yummy. We went for lunch and the place is quiet until we left its starting to be crowded. Best Customer Service

Honestly, the bathrooms were dirty, the floor was oily, and the chicken was dry and there was a hair in it.... But April was an awesome waitress.... She was the only highlight though, which is why I'm even giving them a 2. The could do a lot better for the prices they charge.
Never fails always a good place to get a drink and great service... Quiet and great any day of the week it always comes thru.... And remember to tip your bartender

My husband and I went to Friday's on Saturday afternoon and were annoyed with the service. I asked for a diet coke and the waitress brought it over and when I tried it, it was extremely flat. So when she came back I told her that my diet coke was really flat. She said "really? It's been flat since yesterday." So why give me a beverage that you know is flat? Why not tell me when I order? The jack Daniels chicken strips were amazing as always, the jack Daniels sauce is to die for! The potato skins were decent, they tasted as if they were frozen. The strawberry field salad was great! It could use a little more goat cheese. Our service was ok, our waitress seemed to rush us every time she came over yet we observed her talking to one customer for over 15 minutes. Slightly annoying.  The location seemed darker than normal.  All around it was a decent visit. We will probably try a different location next time.
Terrible slow service that really made my experience bad. Food was at a C- and my Long Island was poorly made. Never will I return again to this location. Cerritos is much better

Came with my family of 9 here, we were originally going to go to cheesecake but the wait was over an hour, we got seated here tho within 30 min which wasn't too bad but even just to get drinks took over 15 mins and our waiter kept walking by so we informed her and she didn't seem pleased that we did but brought them out. After that, just to get our food was extremely slow  about 40 mins I was already at the point of wanting to leave. I came here with my coworkers for lunch on a Friday afternoon. I wanted to eat something with carbs since I had my half marathon on the following Sunday and it was close by! Actually, we wanted to go to Olive's Garden, but it was a 20 minute wait, so we walked to TGI Friday's. But besides that, it was my first time trying this chain restaurant so I didn't have high expectations.  When we got there, there was no line and the hostess promptly sat us down to a booth for the four of us. We were looking through the menu and noticed that they had a special going on for lunch where we got 2 for $20. It included one appetizer and two entrees for $20! So we got that. I ordered a bruschetta chicken pasta and shared chips and salsa as an appetizer. It was surprisingly really yummy! I really liked how the pasta had a spicy kick to it and the chicken was grilled. The portion was pretty large that I had to take at least half of it home. It could have also been the appetizer beforehand. My other two coworkers ordered flat bread as their appetizer and it was so delicious!  I definitely wouldn't mind coming back here, especially with their lunch special! Also, extra points for playing sports on the tv screens. I loved catching up with the NBA preseason games and NFL games.

Nachos and Jack Daniel strips were good and waitress was superb tonight. No complaints from me.

All the food was good, but I will say the macaroni and cheese as well as the strawberry passion tea only deserve four stars. The tea was just ok and the macaroni was good I could just do without the breaded topping cooked on top. Now everything else was great. Chicken and shrimp Cajun pasta, shrimp was cooked perfectly, great flavor with just a little kick of Cajun spice. Tennessee baby back ribs, pull apart tender, great sweet bbq taste. Sweet potato fries crispy and good. Potstickers lightly seared and packed with flavor. I love the pretzel sticks that come with craft beer cheese dipping sauce with applewood bacon and green onions, yum yum, they were my favorite. And to top off the meal we had the Tennessee whiskey cake, a toffee cake with roasted pecans and butterscotch Jack Daniels sauce with a scoop of ice cream, absolutely fantastic.

My experience with this restaurant was terrible. The server (Andrea)was very rude and unprofessional. I understand that sometimes people may have a bad day, but you shouldn't bring it to work. If you are unhappy with your job then you should find another job and let someone else have the job that really wants to work.I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone I know. One should never really expect much from a chain bar/restaurant because most of the time it will kind of be a let down.  I'm giving this review three stars because each visit here weren't completely terrible, but it was my last visit that kind of did it for me. Called ahead of time to get a confirmation as to what time they last call would be and was told that last call would be around 12:15, so we headed over. We arrived at around 11:40pm, mind you that is 35 minutes before they said last call was, an were greeted by the hostess who addressed to us that last call for food and drinks is at 12. Don't know if i'll go back to this location after that experience.

Today was my second time eating here. The first time was ok and the second time was a bit of a step backward as far as the food was concerned.  The server was very polite and professional but the chicken was very bland and rubbery.  Don't know if I will be going back anytime soon.

They are pretty consistent with food and drinks which is how it should be. Customer service has always been more good than bad. The food usually doesn't take too long to come out. The prices are typical for a chain. People have to remember this is a chain and not a mom and pop place, therfore it's regulated for the most part and follows what comes down the pipeline. They keep it clean but should focus on cleaning the table areas more, check on condiments as well, parking is plentiful. If you want variety and good happy hour, then this place is for you. They have decent full size meals as well ranging from ribs, burgers, salads, and much more. Well greased machine that can work on bussing tables.

I'll give her credit though, she was extremely friendly and was honest with her recommendations for drinks... THANKS AMBER!! She rocked. The staff overall seemed flustered though... At one table, they gave him the wrong food. Another booth in front of me got my boyfriend's order, lol. Food: I ordered the bruschetta chicken pasta. My chicken came out SO dry. Randy is the best bartender ever... Just sayin, but Jack the bartender is so, so... Just sayin'.

We ordered black bean burger,  hot chocolate and quesedilla and only quesedilla was somewhat good.  Black bean burger was a disaster and smelled like meat. It is supposed to be a veggie option.  Vegetarians and vegans please stay away please.  They hardly have any options and whatever they have is not good.  This one star is for our server
It never fails.  April is by far the best server my wife and I ever had. The food is always great. I LOVE this Fridays.  Best in the South Bay.

The only thing that keeps me coming back is the food. The host, took us to our table, put the menus down, and kept walking, didn't look back to say anything to us at all. The table and silverware were sticky, you could tell there was bbq sauce on both, Our server seemed very rushed and we could definitely tell he didn't want to be there, I kept saying please and thank you and I don't think I heard one your welcome from him, the drinks were AWFUL I didn't know someone could make a bad margarita. All in all TERRIBLE experience!! Good thing your food is yummy!

We came here on a Saturday afternoon and wanted to catch the Kings vs Ducks "Freeway Faceoff" on tv, that was also being played at the Staples Center.  The best way to watch a game is to go to a sport bar or bar, because you have access to plenty of drinks and can munch on plenty of finger foods. Apparently, TGI Fridays has unlimited appetizers (AYCE) which is perfect for such an occasion.  For $12 a person, you can get as many appetizers you want (from their select menu).  There is a catch.  You can only get 3 appetizers per person at a time.  And, you cannot take home any left overs.   The AYCE menu were FULL size orders of: - Boneless wings with tons of sauces to choose from - Cheesesticks  - Pot stickers  - Crispy green beans - Loaded potato skins - Braised BBQ Beef tostadas - Tuscan spinach dip and BBQ Chicken flatbread We started off with 7 items, 3 wings, cheesesticks, pot stickers, potato skins, tostadas.  Stella was great... Since we were only able to get 3 apps at a time, she first keyed in 3 orders, waited and keyed in the balance a short time later.  Not only did we get the food in an orderly fashion, it also helped us clear the table when the 2nd wave of food came.   We tried all except the spinach dip and flatbread.  For the wings, we tried BBQ, Buffalo, and PB and J... that's right, peanut butter and jelly.  It was... different.  I personally wouldn't order it again.   Our favorites were the pot stickers (we ordered it 2x!), the cheesesticks, green beans, and the BBQ boneless wings. I was amazed how yummy the greenbeans were. They reminded me of fried zucchini sticks. Actually any fried veggie is good, so what am I saying? The ones we did not like was the PB and J and the Tostadas.  The sauce was just too sweet, and then the habanero sauce kicks in, making it too spicy. Not a good balance for our group. The loaded potato skins were ok but the cheese wasn't melted, and the skins were a bit cold.  We could have sent it back, but I thought we'd order more later.  Unfortunately we were quite full after eating 9 plates of food. Thumbs up to the AYCE appetizers.  You have to ask for the menu. They didn't offer it to us until we asked.  It seems they try to push the $4 appetizers in the back of the menu, as its 1/2 orders, smaller portions, and definitely not AYCE.

We went on a Saturday night around 11, so there wasn't too much of a crowd there were plenty of empty tables through out. They choose to sit us next to the drink station  literally  my  boyfriends back was less then 5 inches from the ice. So I asked to be moved, the hostess did move us, to another table but it was dirty instead of cleaning it up she literally put the dessert menu on top. That should've been the first sign to leave. Anyways  we started with  appetizers, we got wings, potatoes skins and mozzarella . The mozzarella  sticks  were the only thing that was good, because they were warm the other two weren't hot at all. When our food finally arrived my plate  was cold, i asked nicely for hot food she did bring it hot, the second time around out. My boyfriend ran out of his drink, and asked for a refill, she took so long that he finished my drink and she brought it at the end of our meal when we asked for our check. The service here has something to be desired hopefully they get it together the food wasn't good either, will definitely be taking my business somewhere else.

Don't eat here if you like cleanliness and good food! No one bussed the tables around us the entire hour we were there!!! So dirty! We got to see everyone's half eaten meals all night! They need new management like yesterday!!
The steak is disappointing. Too much of the portion was fat. Just upset that the $30 steak wasn't what I expected, I should've spoken up, but it was very busy and I just wanted to go.

My family and I came for lunch on Easter. There was no wait, which we we're glad about ! Our server was named Rosa and she seemed pretty nice. She took our drinks, i got a margarita on the rocks, but she ended up bringing it blended. Not a big deal, mistakes happen. I got the jack daniel's steak with mack and cheese and mashed potatoes. The steak was pretty good and once my drink came, it wasn't as strong has i would've hoped.. but i still dranked it. To be honest, our server took forever to come check on us, we had to continuously keep looking around to see if we would spot her. i didn't appreciate appreciate that. They close at 1 and I got there at 12:20... 40 minutes before they close and the host or whoever came to greet me after 2 minutes of waiting in the lobby refused service to me because they already had their "last call." I didn't know that it was okay to turn away customers 40 minutes before closing. Awesome. Dennys won't turn me away and I'll get more food for my dollar anyways.
Service was good. Food was less than average. Wasn't a franchise TGIF so less quality. Bathrooms were disgusting as well. Very disappointed as we are a big TGIF fan

Called in my order. Was told it would take 15 minutes. Sent someone to pick up my food who had to wait 20 minutes from when he got there. Brought food back & it was completely plain. Who orders a turkey burger with nothing on it. When I called to let someone know my order was wrong all the girl on the phone could say was "ok". She could have cared less. I believe they mess up to go orders on purpose. To top it off the food was terrible, had no flavor at all. Will never go to this location again.

Tip: sign up online for membership and receive free deals I've been on a "use my birthday coupons" craze and been stopping at restaurants and restaurants to receive my birthday offers.  TGIF gave me a free appetizer or dessert for my birthday...  Disappointment: it's not a free appetizer... Their offer in small print was written (up to $8 value)... I searched the whole menu and found zero appetizer that costs $8 or lower... So it makes sense because their desserts are about $8 of worth, but for them to give me an email for free appetizer... Came in with my boyfriend and had a great late night dinner. Food was pretty good. Mmmmm mashed potatoes! April, our server, recommended the mango mai tai ahhhhh it was amazing :D She was lovely as well. Be back soon!
Best food ever!! Excellent service. They come to check in on us frequently when I come here.

Came out with the boy's from work trying to celebrate camaraderie, found out a Thursday night is a normal sloooow night. Positives..     food was absolutely bomb. The dirtiest TGIs i ever been, food was more n less ok...  Veggies were dry n old.  Meet had strange smell. This TGI need to be shut down for renevation. Very dissapointing.

First time here in 5 years and now I know why. I never leave a bad review but in this case I was very disappointed in this place. happy hour all day on Sunday! 1/2 off appetizers, always come here for the pretzels and beer cheese!

We order appetizers today which were okay, but the chicken wings were   deformed looking and cold. My Fiancé is way more reasonable and simple with his food and he even wasn't impressed. The Cajun Shrimp and Chicken pasta was out right disgusting. It had no flavor or seasoning and the cream sauce seriously taste like the chef poored it straight from the glass jar it came from.  We sat in the bar, and even that experience was lame. The bartender had his regulars so he pretty much catered to them. And when we asked for items that we were already supposed to have. He came off as being socially awkward, I was over it today.  This review isn't me complaining but, to bring to your attention that the employees are comfortable. Your establishment food taste worse than bar food and the customer experience sucks. Maybe you guys should have a team-building meeting and get back to the meaning of business.

Have been to this place multiple times and never done better than mediocre.  We had a coupon so we went for lunch today, and this will be the last time.  The service was was rather apathetic and mediocre, and the food took forever.  The prices also seem to have gone up from what I remember.   Hubby's cheeseburger was overdone (well done when he requested medium).  The fries were average, but tasted like they'd been sitting out for awhile, and I don't care for the seasoning they are using.  I ordered the turkey burger, and it was straight up burnt.  Several spots tasted like charcoal.  I also ordered mashed potatoes as my side but was given fries.  The waitress did bring me out mashed potatoes when she noticed the error, but they were odd.  So mashed they almost seemed powdered (don't think they were?).  Also, I had two scoops of potatoes--one was warm, one was cold and there was no gravy (I wasn't asked if I wanted gravy, so maybe they just don't serve it with mashed potatoes?).  Anyway, coupon or no, we won't be going back.

Wasn't too impressed with this spot. Had high hopes cuz it is literally down the street from work. We came as a group of like 10 for Happy Hour. Dayum the food they offer for HH is like the stereotypical super fried and fatty and cheesy food. Like potato wedges and cheese sticks. C'mon man up ur game TGIF! Cajun Pasta!! So delicious, comes with chicken and shrimp the flavor has a spicy kick to it, I will definitely order it again. Really liked this location, we sat in the top section above the bar area, they have a lot of tvs. Not only was the food good but the customer service was great Our waitress Genesis was awesome she gave us great advice on the menu, mentioned to us her customers favorites, she always had our cups full, she brought out our food quick and she was very nice and attentive.
great drink food Service waitress always with smile check how it's going often. But then again it's not busy

TGI Fridays is a great place if you want to grab just decent food. Their steaks and meats are "so, so." But you pay for what you get. But their mac n cheese is actually really good! I love the breadcrumbs. They offer different night specials, so you can take advantage of those deals. Their desserts are amazing!!! Service is good, but there is a wait on Friday and Saturday nights.

When you come here you pretty much know what to expect its a chain Restaurant.  Was here last night place was full , wait time was 30-35 minutes but it was not bad . I hadn't been to a Fridays and a long time and after my experience at this Fridays I will be sure to avoid coming to this location. Our whole dining experience took over 2 and half hours and it was mostly just us waiting to get service. Our server was just not on top of her game and she disappeared for long periods of time and our drinks where empty the whole time. The food took 40+ minutes to arrive and once we got our food we had several mistakes, we asked for salmon on one salad and got chicken, we got the wrong sides on another and lastly there was a piece of hair on another dish. Overall I would avoid this location unless you want to wait around for ever.

Went there today. Ordered the double American Burger. It was very tasty and messy but i'm a pig anyway. Service was fast.  I was impressed.  The beer could have been colder but really couldn't complain. Saved $5.00 with a coupon emailed to me last week.  Haven't been here in years.  Will be back.

We used to LOVE TGI Friday's. We came here once a week with our kids. It was our go to restaurant for a good, cheap eats joint. They recently got rid of the 2 for $20 menu. Now it's way overpriced for the quality of the food and the happy hour is $1 off beers. It's just not anything special at all anymore.  That plus the big boy server, one of the worst I have come across, made it a pretty poor experience the last time we were in. He didn't bother to say his name, or even hello. Just a do you guys know what you want? Then, after the food was delivered he never came back to check on us. Not even once. And not like the place was busy at all. It was a Tuesday night. I have been a server before so I know what is acceptable and what is not. This was not. So, we will not be coming back until they change a few things for the better. New management needed? Maybe
A female bartender who closed on a Friday night was super rude,mean and not very classy. It's too bad that I liked that place.

We got there at two o'clock p.m. on a Tuesday.  The place was empty so I figured we had a good shot at getting fresh, hot food.  Everything was cold.  The manager or other server had to bring out food and take our complaints.  Didn't see our waitress often.  I ordered a chicken Cesar salad and it was horrible.  Who in their right mind puts spinach in a Cesar Salad?  returned coffee after asking for fresh brewed decaf.  I got cold regular left over from the morning.  Returned salad and asked for salad to be taken off the bill.  This place is definitely not as good as it used to be.
No two for 20. But they had endless Apps for 10.00. The selection very limited to a few apps. The service is good being the only ones who are in the place.

TGIF is just going down hill as far as staff... it's getting ridiculous ppl are so rude                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     The order is NVR right

Love this Bar & Grill - There is a reason why the chain has been going for 50+ years. Dined here yesterday for lunch, sat at the Bar. Ashley was the bartender. She was very pleasant, efficient, and on top of it. Food was great! Love the lunch menu, great value. Will be back again!!!

Although I really like the food from Friday's, I am extremely disappointed today. My boyfriend and I went to have lunch and we received the Worst service ever from the server Cody. First of all he took a long time to take our order. When he brought the appetizers he did not bring us plates. He didn't provide us with napkins nor silverware until we asked. We asked for A1 Sauce he never brought it to us. He did not check up on us during our time there. First and last time we ever eat at Friday's in Torrance. I seriously suggest that the manager speaks to him because the server Cody is making Friday's look bad. The two stars are only for the food.

I'm feeling generous so what should probably be a 3+ star review is getting rounded up. It's a typical Friday's. Food, if not great, is consistent and tasty nonetheless. Specials are abundant, especially during Happy Hour. You can join their "rewards" club to receive some extracurriculars, (free chips and salsa, two for ones, etc.), if you like. There's plenty of parking outside and the service is "generally" fast and fairly efficient, even though during my last visit, it took almost 20 minutes just for the wife and I to get a couple salads.  Our server was very apologetic however, and told us she was about to bitch-slap the crew in the back when asking what was taking so long. I went so far as to ask her if they were growing the lettuce in the back and she jokingly replied, "they may be... at least it'll be fresh". Nice to see that she had a sense of humor too... It wasn't like we were in any kind of hurry so we didn't mind the wait. It provided an opportunity to consume more adult beverages, ;-) Speaking of beverages, the drink specials are both plentiful and pretty awesome. (Anyone that knows me, knows I like my drinks!!!). The bar area is large and can accommodate about 30 -40 people. Lots of TV's in both the bar area and throughout for your sports viewing pleasure. Store wide, there is plenty of seating so anytime we've gone, there has rarely been a wait, be it at the bar or the tables. We'll continue to go back occasionally, at least until they give us reason not to.
Incompetent and bad service. Don't give them your money. I've seen so many people complain tonight. They really need more staff.

Great food, service and joyful music!  I had a Cobb Grilled Chicken salad that was delicious and fresh!  My friend had a Jack Daniels burger that was to die for:-) Damien was a sweet, efficient and friendly server with a great attitude!  Love this place and will definitely be back

Me and my family stopped by this location on vacation for drinks before dinner, and I was extremely disappointed in this TGIF Friday location's customer service. The hostesses were not personable (as in, they did not greet my group) so we walked to the bar without interacting with them.  The bartenders were overworked and extremely rude--I asked for a glass of wine and the bartender told me they didn't have wine. 10 mins later, I glance over and see another customer with a glass of wine (?). Went to this restaurant and the service was bad. They had a lot of seats but still made us wait for over  30 minutes for no reason.  Went to tgifs for the first time in Vegas it was one of the best times me and my family had. We decided to come on a Friday night!  Get it?! TGIF!  Lol Well I am so glad that I came because I have not been to one in many many years.  I loved the way it is structured inside. It what seems to be 2 floors. the second floor is close to the bar area, I liked it there because you have a view of the whole restaurant.
