Omg common now steak and lobster?! Wow! And the price for it it's not bad at all.  The plates that we decided on were first: Jack Daniel sirloin with mash potatoes and Mac n cheese, which were so delicious by the way. The special jack sauce was perfect.  Second plate: chicken tenders with Seasoned fries! pretty crispy alright! The service was amazing our host was so attentive and nice and amiable. would suggest and offer desserts too.  Will definitely come back again!
Been here a thousand times and have never been disappointed. They're polite and have great deals and there food is amazing.

This is the worst place ive probably ever been. The appetizers took over 45 minutes to reach our table. And what was presented to us as a meal was appalling. They have an interactive tablet at the tables that show pictures of the food and have games. We showed them the pictures of the food compared to what we received and just left. Just pathetic will never come here again, I'm sure the appetizers were done catering style, made beforehand and left under warmers.
Great service and good food.  They greet customers when they walk in the door.  They were busy and the server checked to see if the food is good. Nice workers.  Thank you.

Torrance Food Crawl #133 Over the years I've been to probably over a dozen different TGIFs around the U.S. but this is only the second time I've been to this one, so much closer to home. I was reminded when I walked in and then first opened the menu that if you've been to one TGIF you've sort of been to them all. Of course there will be some differences from location to location but there is more in common. I tried to order a non-alcoholic beer. My server, Amber, said they were out of their normal choice but that the bar recommended Barritts as an alternative. I've never heard of them but went ahead and ordered it. It turned out that Barritts is a Ginger Beer, with water and high-fructose corn sugar as first two listed ingredients. I tried a couple of sips and it tasted like a sweet ginger beer, nothing at all like a beer. Credit should go to Amber because she noticed that I hadn't taken more than a couple of sips and without me asking her she deducted the soda from my bill. I hope that whoever works the bar learns to make better recommendations. I started with the New England Clam Chowder. Its OK but I would have preferred that it have less onion, and more cream and/or potato. My entree was the Grilled Salmon. I know that at a corporate chain I'm not going to get fresh fish but frozen and resurrected can be fine. It was grilled but not quite to the extent that it would be blackened. It was a little dry tasting but good. The default sides of rice pilaf and steamed spinach were both good.

It's been YEARS since I've gone to a Fridays and now I remember why. Although our server was nice, he rarely bothered to check on us and didn't explain the ONE HOUR wait for the appetizers. The restaurant wasn't too busy, so I don't understand the wait and the cold entrees. At the end of our dinner, we had an accident that resulted in a spilled soda. The tables next to us were empty and a worker was sweeping at the next table over, but somehow didn't hear the glass cup slam nor our exclamations. Overall, one of the worst restaurant experiences of my life.

Never a complaint when I come here.  Food is yummy and drinks are so good. Love the fried green beans and the dipping sauce, and the Jack Daniels flat iron steak.... love love love the jack daniels sauce so I ask for extra on the side.  Employees are always friendly, warm and welcoming.

I had an awful experience at this establishment. We waited over 10 minutes for anyone to take our drink orders. We asked if there were any specials and got a short answer. Our area was not clean and we ended up leaving because of the poor service.

Food is almost always unfavorable and overpriced. Customer service is okay. The restrooms are absolutely atrocious and I have never walked in without being completely grossed out by how filthy it is. You can get more for your money, good food, and better kept restrooms at Norms.

location: South East LA, Los Angeles, CA
review: Food is too bland. Alcohol drinks are just kids drinks. The turkey could have more flavor. And the steak and lobster was so so. Nothing to go crazy about.

Don't know where to go? Can't go wrong with TGI Friday! TGI Friday is located on Hawthorne Blvd and Lomita. They have a large parking lot sharing with other businesses! They have a large water fountain in front of their restaurant which is really nice. Once inside, we were seated within few minutes on a Sunday night. Our waiter was very friendly and service was great. We ordered appetizers and they were very delicious! My sidekick-#3 Daisy ate them all! We got the spinach dip and cheese sticks! Props to the waiter, the dishes were really hot and he managed to bring it to our table.  For our main course, I got the vegetarian burger with comes with small fries. It was good except it lacked a little seasoning on the patty. Overall everything was great.  I would recommend coming here if you want to have some casual dinner with friends or family.
The fact that this place is empty during the NCAA  Final says it all. Cold appetizers, even colder service. Server hid off the floor most of the time. Not coming here again...nope, never!!!

Good service from our server!  No complaints with her service.  The lunch special is meh nothing special. We had the jack Daniel ribs half rack and it's small serving.  If your hungry might as well get the the full rack. The burger we ordered is too well done bordering to burnt. That was a big minus.  We ordered the endless app same nothing to rave about another meh. Then we ordered the steak and lobsters the 14.99 promo.  Another meh. Steak was hard and the lobster is tiny but it has good seasoning.  That was a plus and the desert of vanilla bean cheese cake was also good. Last thing I would like to mention is the waiting time for the food to come out. 2 hours for our lunch. Not good if your with a time constraint.
Don't but the $10 all you can eat appetizers! It is nasty and salty! I'm very disappointed.

I have no idea why this place only has 2 1/2 stars because from what I experienced, this TGIF place deserves 4 stars at least!  Food: -I got the flat iron steak with mashed potatoes and stirred broccoli and heck, it was soooo good! I loved it! The meat was very juicy and savory. I couldn't ask for more! The mashed potatoes and broccoli were super good too!  -My bf got the unlimited appetizers for $10 only. It was a pretty good deal considering he could order mozzarella sticks, chicken wings, and other good stuff for only 10 dollars! He seemed to enjoy it as he tried all the appetizers.  Service: -Our server was superb! He was very upbeat and friendly. He knew what food and drinks to recommend to us and I was very satisfied. He made sure we were served well and that we were accommodated. It was pretty busy when we came but  Overall, I will definitely come back to this TGIF place! I had a good time! :)

First let me say I gave this establishment three chances to make it right before I wrote this review. I work up in Palos Verdes , and get off at 2:45 and being that it's convenient I use to enjoy TGIF 14.99 Steak and Lobster from 3-6pm . However the last three visits I ordered this meal and each time the baked potato was a day old. Which I'm certain they'd deny that, but one would guess that at 3 pm the spuds would be freshly baked. This has happened now three visits in a row at approximately the same time (around 3 ish) you might question how I would know it was a day old? Well the skin was completely separated in parts from the potato and the was also very hard and dark in color - it's hard to describe but let's just say what it wasn't -a freshly baked potato!! Now in to the lobster, I asked for steamed (not grilled) it was almost a beige color and all they did to cover up an old lobster was sprinkle a ton of season salt to mask the poor lobster!  Now, I realize it's only $15 but cmon now !!! At least give me something fresh. Will I go back? Probably...But don't lure us in for a great deal and then serve us sub par food. The steak was perfect, side was ok , and dessert was delish (Wiskey Toffy Cake)

Some church friends and I went in for a Sunday bite, we didn't know they have all day Happy Hour on Sundays  1/2 off on apps & other things. Food was delicious but we couldn't really find much on the healthier options (costs you 1 star, TGIF!). Company I was with made up for it, but then the server wasn't very attentive. Yes it was a bit busy, it wasn't full then either. We had to follow up on our hot waters with another person and also ordered dessert with her as well. Got the bill and saw we were charged for another item that we had initially requested but canceled right away in the beginning. I'm pretty patient but yea that overall thing that happened compacted which also costed another star.

I'll give it 2 stars for the food and our actual server. Hostess  and all the hostess standing with her are very unprofessional. Their  incompetence truly baffles me. I will find out the name of that hostess who worked last night 4/29/2017. We checked in at 620pm. We were there till about 8pm. So she was there at those times. She was heavy set and black hair pulled up into a little bun. She is the worst human being ever. Once I get her full name I will run to her superiors and trash her like the trash she already is. She should not be working with the public!!! She's rude, arrogant and looked dirty! Glad she wasn't my server. I would have rejected her service to us. As for that, and that reason only. I would not be returning to this location. EVER!!!
Very disappointed with this TGIF.. food was not .... no comment at all but have to say something

Soooo disappointed in today's visit. Cane with my sister on a Sunday for lunch/dinner. Got a new waiter, said he's been here for about a week and a half. Ordered endless apps for $10 and a quesadilla. He mentioned that the quesadilla would be out later than the rest of the food because it isn't an app...ok, cool! So food comes out and everything except for the Dang on wings...so I'm waiting, the table across from us gets theirs and I'm still waiting, and waiting and waiting until I had to pull him over to our table and ask where the wings were. He proceeds to say oh, let me put an order in for you now. So now I'm a little frustrated. He finally returns to our table about 10 mins later with wings....but they aren't even the kind I ordered. Iy iy iy! Very nice guy, but I think he just needs to slow down and write some things down. Meanwhile, everybody around us who's just sat down are getting full entree's at their table, and I'm still waiting.....

One of the worse experience ever; this would be negative 3 or 4 stars if it's possible.  Our appetizer came relatively good time.  But then meals came, so late.  My stake and lobster was cold; only thing warm on my plate was spinach, my husband's chicken was leathery, my son's burger was like McDonald's burgers.  Taste, I have NOTHING great about to say.  And finally ready to leave after paid with Kiosk on the table, server came to tell me that Kiosk on our table is for different table and I just paid someone else's food.  Server told me that they refund the money but may take a month to get refund; manager corrected it'll be 3 to 4 business days.  But still! Really???  Serioisly????  Will never ever go to any of TGI Fridays since this is 2nd TGI Fridays in different states, different times, and both sucked!

happened to be at tgif on Saturday night, after long wait got our order delivered with fries being not fresh and spaghetti like, burger had a patty which was so hard that it was not easily chewable may be a burnt one or old frozen one. flat bread was extremely salty may be because of cheese. but overall it was very bad and  disappointing dine at this location.

Six months ago my family & I went here ... once we were seated at our table we ordered quickly & waited for our meal to come... and waited and waited and waited! Finally we just got up & left. Last week we tried it again on Mother's Day but THE SAME THING HAPPENED! It was NOT the waitress, in fact both times it was issues with the kitchen. We got the manager she said she would speed it up (we had been waiting 50 minutes at that point) so as MORE time passed (15 more min) we left again!  Their KITCHEN is not proficient.

There service is soooo horrible! They had us waiting over 20mins for a table for two yet there were so many empty tables. Then when they finally sat us down they moved us from our table because the host over booked a waitress and due to her being pregnant as the hostess she couldn't handle being over booked.. But our male waiter was nice.

We hadn't been to Fridays in quite some time, decided to give it a try again. The service was very slow, it took about 10 minutes after we were seated to put in a drink order. We placed our order, then waited again for our drinks. My husband ordered the bacon cheeseburger, I ordered the Cobb salad. My salad was actually very good, no complaints there at all, but my husband's cheeseburger was quite tough and the bun squished down to about 1/8" thickness. He ended up peeling the last third of the bun off the meat. His fries were pretty good though. We had a coupon to get a free dessert and we ordered the vanilla bean white chocolate cheesecake to split between us. Now, that was delicious! We will probably go back but it will be awhile before we do.

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: 30$ for 2 endless apps, & 2 20oz beers?? Hell yes!! Food was on point! The jack Daniel boneless wings tho....... mmmmm mmmm mmmmm!!! Deliciousness!

we were supposed to eat at Olive Garden next door but the wait time is over an hour so we decided to eat here. The wait time is 25-30 mins which is ok. We sat and the waiter took our order and the food took a lot time. Finally our food arrived but the steaks and lobster tail was cold, fries was soggy and the crispy chicken fingers came with a strand of hair stuck in between the breading and the meat. The kids meal that we ordered supposed to come with a lemonade but it was water. We asked one waiter for utensils but I guess she forgot, so we asked another waiter but it took him 4-5 minutes to get it (mind you our food came in cold). The waiter didn't gave us napkins too. We are never going back to this place!

Tried this location and they can't even get people seated. Open tables everywhere, but they can't get it together enough to get them filled. I guess I'll watch the first quarter standing and hungry. If it wasn't possibly the last game I'd leave for sure! Someone tried to come over to me and console me, but there's no reason to leave a 2 top open for 20 min with people waiting! I'm not angry and while I appreciate the sentiment,  I'd rather see some simple problem solving. Hopefully my server will be on point. And turn the sound on, it's the NBA finals. People like to watch AND hear.. . apparently the sound is on. They must have the worst system ever Gotta go from 1 to 2 stars.. they were trying, someone did make an effort to talk to me (proactive) and there was one dude helping host and expedite that was cool, friendly,  and didn't try and bs me (just did what he could and talked to me normally. And he was hustling doing little things that probably don't get noticed. Kudos to that guy) The staff seemed nice,  I think with a little more leadership and communication things would be smooth. Everyone just seemed weeded. I get it, that's service. I've been there. I wouldn't be afraid to come back, just a busy time with grads and game

Absolutely horrible. Waiter took 30 minutes to come after being seated. Drinks come 50 minutes after being seated and some were forgotten and others were incorrect. Ordered endless apps. Been waiting for a total of 1 hr 46min 14seconds and have not recieved my food. Have seen about 4 families who sat down after me get their food. Absolutely irritated.  Bathroom was disgusting. Tissue and toilet paper everywhere. The little bit if food that did come the plates piled up and weren't picked up. Would not reccommend dining here.
I am a regular visit after work. I always have Jack as a bartender  on the counter and He give me  excellent service.

The staff and manager "dirty Sanchez" sucked huge whale ballz! My family of 7 and I went for my sons birthday and take advantage of the appetizer special only to be scolded that absolutely NO sharing was allowed! I asked for the manager (dirty Sanchez) to address my concern and he only made things worse by brushing off my concern. DO NOT EAT HERE! Their corporate office was of no use either!

Seating was quick tonight. I've been here a few times but this time I decided to review because the service was really bad.  I understand how it is sometimes working with the public, especially service but from the rest of the reviews here, I feel it's pretty common for this place to have bad customer service.  Our waitress was really slow & she only had 3 tables. I had to ask her 3 times for water & she never once gave us utensils. Several other waiters & waitresses brought us our appetizers which was odd but at least one of them finally gave us utensils.  Food was okay but we had to wait so long just for one refill & a few appetizers. People here are beyond lazy.

Came in today for happy hour waitress was nice but the Host was just plain rude she asked me if my children were gonna stay in their stroller or if they needed a high chair I was like yes my kids would like to eat with us...wtf why would I leave my kids in stroller while I eat rude also there was three girls at the host both laughing and cracking jokes doing absolutely nothing couldn't even here my husband speak not to mention she sat us right by the stairs and exit will never come back here cocktail shrimp was sooooooo grossss and the chicken sandwich my husband ordered taste like rubber like some weird texture to it and it was super soggy. Bye TGIF no more chances your on my black list.

this post is for the service.  hailey was our server tonight and she was phenomenal. exceeded our expectations! did not expect such great friendly thoughtful service from this establishment! ^^ thank you hailey! you rock!

Horrible experience! Our waiter walked up drooling on himself like Hercules from Sandlot, sweating like he got done running 5 on 5 in Africa during July & crying like he found out his wife was born a man, trying to take out order. He couldn't understand saying I wanted an order of wings. We went back & forth for 3 mins trying to get the order right! Finally the manager walked up & escorted him to the back & took our order. When the bill came it had one amount on it & when we swiped our cards, we got over charged by $20!!!! The manager was unable to change it because the computers were down!

This is the local TGI Friday's and the service has become such a joke. This is probably the third time in a row we have had such bad service. In fact; i believe this is my first ever yelp review just to warn others! The wait was long even though many seats were available. Our waiter also took sometime to serve us. From the time we ordered our food; another group arrived, ordered and received their food before our waiter told us our food would be "right out." Since ordering; 45 min has passed. For 2 people! Food was cold and when we told him, he said if it was up to him; they would be hot! WHAT?! How about offer to replace? So agitated! Never coming here again and will spread the word online. Terrible terrible.

This was our first time here and it was great! I'm writing this before driving off because it was better then expected. The food was great for the price, happy hour appetizers were great as well and our super great server Christine was the cherry on top. Very low key great! My daughter said "this place is bomb!" Lol Thanks !

We usually eat Friday at least once a month, and this recent visit was horrible. The food took over an hour, they didn't even have all the food ready and to top it off they had one of our orders wrong. I understand that they are busy, but our waitress didn't even acknowledge us after we've been waiting, she didn't update us on our food, and didn't even apologize for the long wait. I'll be visiting another Friday's next time!!!!

Randy is the worst bar tender/server EVER! He didn't acknowledge me at all. I had to say "excuse me, can you take my order?" After 20 minutes of waiting for him to greet me. I ordered a $20 dinner and he didn't offer me a glass of water. How rude!!! But, I guess I would be angry too if I was bartending at 60 years old. No tip for him.

This is actually one of my places to run always and wined down in anyday of the week that ends with a Y. The environment is always amazing and the music is always on top . The greeters are usually on their game and up to speed in getting us seated . My favorite plate to eat there would be the wings the lemon and regular hot sauce . The fries there are also amazing ! not even greasy and they are fresh  ! and their beer selections are very good . Also the prices aren't even that bad ! and the sizes of the appetizers are perfect to share in a group of 4. so if your looking for a spot to chill back and have a good time check it out i promise you won't be disappointed

I went out with a few friends to this TGIF, and let me just say it was the biggest mistake of our lives. The waitress was flat out rude. There was seriously 15 people in the restaurant and the food took an hour and  thirty minutes to come out. To add Insult to injury the food was garbage. I won't ever come back here that's for sure!

Our party of 11 waited about 40 minutes to be seated in a half empty restaurant, that should've been our first indicator. The hostess informed us that our waiter wasn't set to be on the floor until 4pm (it was 3:50pm when we were seated). Our waiter, Joseph, immediately took our drink order and said he would be back for our food order. We ordered appetizers and entrees and chatted happily until our food came. It took 1 hour to get our appetizers. Our food slowly came in, one by one. One person in our party still didn't not receive her food. By this time, it's 5:45pm. The manager came over to speak (he could have used a bit of extra training in customer service 101) and comped the entree and gave a dessert to our starving member. Joseph apologized for the terrible service stating "the restaurant is a mess". The bathrooms were also a bit on the unclean side with toilet paper everywhere and soap dispensers opened. It seemed as if the floor was understaffed as all of the waiters were sprinting around everywhere. I felt so bad for them. It seems as if there needs to be some assistance with staffing the correct amount of employees. This restaurant didn't use to be like this. I hope they make some changes for the better!

Service was absolutely horrible. Took over an hour to get an appetizer to the table. The waiter's response: "our restaurant is a complete mess right now!" The ribs were boiled!  The salads were dry!  They ran out of honey for the tea. They ran out of tea cups and our second tea was delivered in some other kind of cup - but who wants tea when u have no honey? Never again!

We just tried "Forever Endless" promotion. It's not "Forever Endless". You have to order them one at a time which I am ok with BUT the reorders take forever to arrive. By the time they bring the 2nd reorder you already have lost your appetite. It's more like a scam than an actual promotion. So you really pay $13.99 for an order that is probably$5.99. We waited more than 15 minutes for the 2nd order and it never arrived so we asked for cancellation of the order and left. It really ruined our dinner plan. The crew was very nice as always but they are put in a very bad situation. Bait and switch! Honest?????

My All TIME WORST Experience at ANY TGI Fridays I've ever had, was late night ...I'm generally not a huge fan of Fridays but I decided to go for it anyhow. yes the place only had 10 people there at most which should have been my first negative indicator but I was actually looking for a place that wasn't too crowded so I didn't mind the emptiness of the atmosphere.  They were desperately extending the happy hour time to increase the drink purchases but simultaneously the drinks were terrible and watered down so I only ordered the one then after I received the food I ordered the endless wings ( which at the time I wasn't told you can only get in boneless style), I clearly expressed that I wanted them traditional style before I ordered and was still brought boneless and was told (with an attitude) "you can switch to regular price for traditional if you want"..but since it was in front of my face already I just said forget it (as I'm sure they expected) okay so one flavor which was the garlic parmesan was tasty and freshly made hot, the other flavor which was Buffalo felt like it had been sitting out for quite some time and wasn't even bothered to be heated up... also my girlfriends entree of JD chicken and  friedshrimp was terrible as well. The chicken was rubbery and You could tell by the black color of the shrimp tails that they had been frozen well past there shelf life...service wasn't the best either Just ultimately a very terrible experience and I will never visit this location again nor did I leave a tip. I put a big fat zero on that line in the receipt for a reason. Don't get me wrong I could never hold a TGI Fridays to a five star restaurant standards, but my service and food quality at this particular location was Far Below what I would even expect from a McDonald's for example. I was just completely disappointed especially due to the beautiful location of this restaurant I expected more for whatever reason, but I will continue to visit The Compton or even Long Beach Towne Center locations if I ever have a craving for T.G.I Fridays ever again.

How can on the website & advertisement on TV they say it's a $10 special then you call them and they say they're participating in the 12.99 special try to get a different type of barbecue sauce and they want $1.00 more that's horrible they shouldn't be a part of the franchise if there are independently owned and don't abide by the prices that are given by t g i Fridays

Ok lunch special yes i get it should be small. But literally 4 bites of chicken. This is a kids meal. If you look at the menu it shows at least a half a chicken breast. Waitress was 5 stars. Do not order the bruschetta chicken pasta for lunch! Also its friday and no happy hour or drink special worth buying.
They messed up for changing the mac and cheese I recommend that don't order Mac and cheese nomore why pay more at this place if I could make the regular Mac and cheese at home disappointed

So I get charged twice and I call with in an hour and the girl tells me she doesn't know how it's possible that I got charged twice if it's only showing one receipt! Clearly on my bank account I got charged twice! So now she's calling me a liar. I swear worst customer service ever. Never going back again.

This is the absolute WORST!!!!! I've been waiting 40 minutes for my food and it took 20 minutes just to get a beer!!! (Bar is literally walking distance from our table) to top it off our waiter looks annoyed by any questions  the worst

Today my family and I went to TGIF to have an early dinner around 4pm. It took over 10 minutes to even get a host to come over to be seated. Once she got there, she told me it would be more then a 40 minute wait. There were open tables throughout the restaurant but she said she has to find the hostess so they can start seating people. Very bad customer service, they need to get it together! Especially on the weekend? You don't know where the hostess is! We left without eating.

This TGI Friday's is not one to go to . Avoid at all costs . My family and I visited this establishment 2 nights ago. We were in the restaurant for over an hour and a half to receive our food . The waitress forget item after item . We had to ask her multiple times to bring each thing . How can you eat without any drink at all? Maybe it was because she was the only waitress for half the restaurant !  The food was good , but maybe that's because it took forever to get there so after waiting an hour and half I was that much more hungry .  We left , went home and the next morning my brother and I had THE WORST food poisoning we have ever had , I puked at least 25 times over a 12 hour period , had a fever and still have diarrhea . Maybe the reason for the food taking so long was because the cook was also the dishwasher and wasn't washing his hands in between . Or maybe he was rushing because they were so understaffed that he was cutting my salad vegetables with a raw meat knife . Whatever it was it ultimately comes down to horrible management .  This restaurant is a disgrace . And I will never go to this location or any  TGI Friday's ever again . I had to stay home 2 days from work because of their negligence . Disgusting . I lost a lot of money because of their laziness . I would have given this place 0 stars , but that's not an option . It doesn't even deserve one star.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS .

Worst dining experience we've had at TGI Fridays!  We will never return.   Should have checked the reviews.  What happened to this restaurant? What happened to quality of food??  Service was horrible.... and they weren't even busy!!  Took forever to get our drinks then forever to get our meal.  I ordered the streak and lobster.   I ordered my streak medium rare.   It was well done.   On top of it,  looked like my plate was sitting there for a while.   My bf ordered the sliders and a basket of fries.   Fries didn't arrive until he had 1 slider left.   I had to complain about my steak so they brought another out which was now RARE!. Almost raw. Waitress was full of excuses and came across like she didn't care.    X'd this restaurant out! Never again.
Richard the manager is super nice! We had a problem and he took care of it right away and treated us very well. Thank you for your service Richard

I have been to quite a few TGI Fridays but this location is the worst.  To start with it is dirty, the place was empty (bad sign) and still trash and food all over the floor.  Asked for a booth, they were all dirty and the host couldn't understand why we couldn't just sit at a table.    Ordered the pretzel w/cheese and after dipping 3 or 4 times the cheese was gone, with over half the pretzel left they said they had to charge for more cheese. Overall the food was cold and greasy.
Love this place i love the staff and the food no wait time great cusyomer service best food

Did not actually eat because after entering the restaurant, with only 3 tables sat and maybe 3 people at the bar, we waited for the hostess, after being sat we waited for another 10 minutes with no contact from a waiter to even offer beverages.  We left poor service.  I would give no stars if allowed.

So I must let you guys know, this was by far the worst service. So we arrive and we're told it would be about a 35 minute wait. we finally come in and they take us a little sooner and we get seated. We order some appetizers and they did come out pretty good. We then ordered our food and it took almost 45-50 minutes to get our food to us. My mom, brother and his girlfriend ordered rib eyed steaks. My mom ordered it medium well and my brother ordered his medium. His girlfriend ordered it medium well also. So we patiently wait for our food understanding that it's Christmas Day and there's many people waiting on their food too. So we finally get the food and 2 major issues. The food was all cold and all rib eyed steak was made well done. Not tender whatsoever. Looked like a brick and also was burnt and well over cooked. Really frustrating because if we're going to wait almost an hour for our food at least it should be made as we asked it to be especially for how LONG we waited.. My brothers was the worst of them all because his steak was by far over cooked. He had to ask them to remake it and the rest of us decided to stay with our dish for the fact that it would only take another hour to get our food remade. I ordered the Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta. It was cold by the time I got it. So of course when our waiter came by to ask how everything was and that the steak would be out shortly, we informed her that everything was not okay the food was cold and our orders were not as we asked. She then says okay I'm sorry about that let me inform my manager. She eventually comes back informing us one appetizer would not be charged and one meal would not be Charged and when we receive the check it shows that they only didn't charge the rib eye which makes no sense because that's just one of the dishes on the plate not even the meal as they promised. We didn't ask that they subtract a meal and appetizer, they offered so don't promise something you won't fulfill. Because then they didn't even take off an appetizer and over all only took off one meal. With that being said, horrible experience. On top of all this.. as we were waiting for the steak to be remade, a waiter assisting the family behind us was informing them that a lot of customers orders were getting messed up and that the food is taking a while due to have to remake numerous customers orders again. So wouldn't you think if a few customers were having there orders messed up, you would try to make sure you don't mess up anymore orders for anyone else ??? Given the amount of time it's consuming and you guys would think they wouldn't want to lose business. Like clearly you guys do not care about your customers or your business to be consistently messing up everyone's orders ! Didn't even tip them it was by far the worst service go else where ! The T.G.I. Friday's in Downey was slightly better if you're gunna order anything from T.G.I. Friday's just get appetizers or anything that doesn't include meat. You'll be better off that way. I go to this location relatively often mainly for its location and convenience. I've written good and bad reviews about this place.  The last few times there service seems to have improved. The staff and waiters are friendly and relatively attentive.  As for the food it's nothing to brag about. Meat typically is overcooked a not especially flavorful. But it's not bad for the money.  Definitely a good place to be for noisy sports fans (which is why I avoid the place during televised sporting events). On those nights, even if you are seated away from the bar, the yelling and screaming can be overwhelming.  If you go to watch a game there are TV screens seemingly everywhere.
